title: Data Analyst - Remote | WFH
description: Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data? We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making and provide valuable insights.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Conduct data analysis and profiling to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies.<br><br>Maintain and enhance existing data processes, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.<br><br>Utilize SQL and Python to query, extract, and analyze data from various sources.<br><br>Create visually appealing and insightful visualizations using Tableau.<br><br>Generate monthly reports, highlighting key findings and recommendations.<br><br>Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent practical experience.<br><br>Strong proficiency in SQL and Python for data querying and analysis.<br><br>Experience creating compelling visualizations using Tableau.<br><br>Solid understanding of data analysis techniques and methodologies.<br><br>Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.<br><br>Strong communication and collaboration skills.<br><br><strong><u>Additional Skills (2-4 Years Of Experience)<br><br></u></strong>Proficiency in Tableau for advanced data visualization.<br><br>Solid programming skills in Python for data manipulation and analysis.<br><br><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Minimum of 2-4 years of experience in Tableau.<br><br><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Minimum of 2-4 years of experience in Python.<br><br>Healthcare industry background is a plus.<br><br>Local to Illinois, but open to remote work.<br><br>Please note that a background check will be conducted for this position.<br><br>Join our team and unlock the power of data to drive meaningful insights and impact! Apply now to embark on an exciting journey of data exploration and analysis<br><br>Disclaimer: This job description is intended to convey information essential to understanding the scope of the position and is not an exhaustive list of skills, efforts, duties, or responsibilities associated with it.<br><br>I hope this revised job description captures the essence of the role and presents it in a more engaging and exciting manner for potential job seekers. Let me know if you need any further adjustments or if there's anything else I can assist you with!<br><br>Employment Type: Contractor<br><br>Salary: $ 48,000.00 114,000.00 Per Year

description: <strong>Position: Data Analyst<br><br></strong><strong>Location: 100% REMOTE <br><br></strong><strong>Job Type: 6 months contract Possible extension <br><br></strong><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong><strong>Job description: <br></strong><ul><li>Data analysis and profiling</li><li>Maintenance of existing processes</li><li>Querying and analyzing data with SQL and Python</li><li>Creating visualizations using Tableau</li><li>Executing monthly reports.</li><li>Querying and analyzing data with SQL and Python</li><li>Creating visualizations using Tableau<br></li></ul><strong><u>Additional Skills<br><br></u></strong>Tableau 2-4 years<br><br>Python 2-4 years<br><br><strong><u>Required Skills<br><br></u></strong><strong>Basic Qualification : <br><br></strong><strong>Additional Skills : </strong>Sr. Data analyst with minimum 9 years of experience Required Skills: Data analysis, Strong in SQL, Source to target mapping, Python and Tableau NOTE:- Looking for healthcare background local to IL can work remote<br><br>Background Check :Yes

title: Data Research Analyst, gt.school (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Data Research Analyst key responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python, R, or any other general-purpose programming language (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-DataResearchAn.007<p><br></p>
job_function: Business Development, Information Technology, and Research
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Financial Services

title: Data Analyst
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Do</strong><p><br></p><strong>As part of our </strong><strong>Enterprise Data Management team</strong><strong>, you’ll:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop data-driven solutions with current and next generation technologies to meet evolving business needs. </li><li>Provide technical design and develop Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) applications that interface with all key Discover applications. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>How You’ll Do It</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and develop data-ingestion frameworks, real-time processing solutions, and data processing and transformation frameworks.  </li><li>Deploy and provide support for application codes and analytical models. </li><li>Provide senior-level technical consulting to peer data engineers during design and development for highly complex and critical data projects. </li><li>Create and enhance data solutions that enable seamless integration and flow of data across the data ecosystem.  </li><li>Provide business analysis and develop ETL code and scripting to meet all technical specifications and business requirements according to the established designs.  </li><li>Develop real-time data ingestion and stream-analytic solutions leveraging technologies such as Kafka, Apache Spark, Python and AWS-based solutions.  </li><li>Work extensively within the Cloud ecosystem and migrate data from Teradata to AWS-based platform.  </li><li>Utilize multiple development languages/tools such as Python, SPARK, Hive, Java to build prototypes and evaluate results for effectiveness and feasibility.  </li><li>Develop application systems that comply with the standard system development methodology and concepts for design, programming, backup, and recovery to deliver solutions that have superior performance and integrity.   </li><li>Contribute to determining programming approach, tools, and techniques that best meet the business requirements.  </li><li>Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, preparation of specifications and plans for the development of data processes.  </li><li>Offer system support as part of a support rotation with other team members.  </li><li>Operationalize open source data-analytic tools for enterprise use.  </li><li>Ensure data governance policies are followed by implementing or validating data lineage, quality checks, and data classification.  </li><li>Understand and follow the company development lifecycle to develop, deploy and deliver the solutions.    </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications You’ll Need</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Basics:</strong><strong> </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, or related field  </li><li>4+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering  </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years of experience in data platform administration/engineering  </li><li>Knowledge and experience using query languages (SQL, Cypher) for relational and graph databases  </li><li>Willingness to continuously learn &amp; share learnings with others  </li><li>Capability to collaborate with stakeholders and project leaders to understand requirements, deliverables, and set expectations on tasks that you will be responsible for </li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment </li><li>Experience working in an agile and collaborative team environment  </li><li>Design and develop AtScale models based on data modeling of business requirements and entities </li><li>Great understanding of OLAP and dimensional modeling</li><li>Working knowledge in building multi-dimensional cubes, creating dimensions, facts, measures etc</li><li>Proficient in MDX and DAX</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following OLAP tools Microsoft SSAS, MicroStrategy, IBM Cognos etc</li><li>Experience with one or more of the following BI tools Tableau, PowerBI etc</li><li>Experience in solution delivery roles for business intelligence and data analytics</li><li>Experience in working with cloud databases and architectures such as Snowflake, AWS or Azure is a nice to </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Data Engineer
description: Skiltrek is in search of a business systems analyst for a 12 month plus contract. They need to have the ability to gather requirements, but also technical skills within SQL to pull data and create reports. This role requires 2x a week on-site in the city. Manager is ready to interview after the holiday, candidates are encouraged to apply.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Details</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Solid understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Project Delivery Framework</li><li> Experience producing wireframes and other visual representations of systems</li></ul><p><br></p>for use with non-technical stakeholders<p><br></p><ul><li> Familiarity with creating and maintaining traceability matrices.</li><li> Experience working with SQL as determined by the business and</li></ul><p><br></p>technology.<p><br></p><ul><li> College or university degree and/or relevant work experience</li><li> Proficient in working with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)</li><li> Proficient in working with JIRA.</li><li> Knowledge and experience with developing requirements in agile and waterfall</li></ul><p><br></p>methodologies.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US.<p><br></p>At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances,<p><br></p>be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender,<p><br></p>race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

title: Analyst, gt.school (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description: <strong>Job TITLE: </strong>Business Intelligence (BI) Developer<br><br><strong><u>Job DESCRIPTION<br><br></u></strong><strong>The BI Developer </strong>builds, maintains, and improves data transformations, data repositories and related reports and dashboards<strong>. The BI Developer will work closely with the data architect, business analysts, and IT leadership to deliver and improve data and reporting solutions for the organization.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job RESPONSIBILITIES<br></u></strong><ul><li>Design, develop, improve, verify, and support custom Data Warehouse, Data Marts, and Power BI visualizations, dashboards, and paginated reports</li><li>Design, develop, and maintain Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) packages to extract, transform, and load data into data repositories </li><li>Understand data and process flows to investigate, track, manage, communicate, and improve data issues across systems</li><li>Enhance existing data models to implement new measures, facts, and dimensions </li><li>Create and modify SQL views and stored procedures</li><li>Ensure code management best practices</li><li>Daily monitoring and error handling of data solutions to ensure data availability</li><li>Maintain data refreshes and gateway connections, troubleshoot data refresh failures; provide after-hours support when needed <br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge, SKILLS, AND Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Extensive SQL development, SSIS, and ETL/ELT experience required</li><li>Extensive experience with Power BI desktop and paginated reports, workspaces, applications, and DAX measures required</li><li>Knowledge of dimensional modeling and data translation concepts and practices required</li><li>Prior ERP experience preferred</li><li>Manufacturing and distribution industry experience preferred</li><li>QlikView and Crystal Reports experience a plus</li><li>Must be able to manage multiple work items at one time with a high sense of urgency.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to collaborate and communicate well with team members and stakeholders </li><li>Must possess strong problem solving and organizational skills<br></li></ul><strong>EDUCATION:</strong> Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience<br><br><strong>EXPERIENCE:</strong> 3 - 5 years of experience as a BI Developer<br><br><strong>WORK LOCATION:</strong> Gurnee, Illinois<br><br><strong>Employment Status:</strong> Full Time<br><br><strong>Travel required:</strong> N/A

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: Since 1952, Lawson Products has worked hard to make our customers' jobs easier by improving their operational efficiency, productivity and overall performance. As a leader in the MRO industry, we partner with customers to make sure they have the right maintenance and repair parts on hand when needed.<p><br></p>We’re looking for a motivated Data Warehouse Developer responsible for preparing corporate data for reporting and analysis using the relational database and OLAP technologies. This position will analyze and develop complex logical database designs, logical data models and relational data definitions in support of corporate and customer information systems requirements.<p><br></p>Our corporate headquarters is located in Chicago, IL. This role operates on a hybrid work model, spending at least three days per week working in the office. We offer a competitive benefits package that includes 401k plus vision, dental and medical coverage. Employees also receive a paid holiday and PTO package.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Develops data models to meet the needs of Lawson's information systems. Responsible for the identification and resolution of information flow, content issues and the transformation of business requirements into logical data models. </li><li> Designs and develops ETL solutions using SAP Data Services. </li><li> Manages the flow of information between departments through relational databases. </li><li> Maintains data integrity by reducing data redundancy, trends in data use and single sources of data. </li><li> Stays current on the ways Lawson uses its data. </li><li> Mentors junior development resources. </li><li> Supports and maintains existing ETL data flows and the data warehouse environment. </li><li> Other duties, as assigned. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications &amp; Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Requires a bachelor's degree, plus 5 years of experience in data modeling and development, or an equivalent combination of education and experience </li><li> Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals. </li><li> Business Objects or other enterprise BI suite experience a plus. </li><li> 5-7 years of ETL development experience. SAP Data Services experience preferred. </li><li> In-depth understanding and demonstrated proficiency in data warehousing concepts, best practices, and dimensional database design. </li><li> Cross-functional experience with sales, human resources, finance or operations. </li><li> Understands the methodologies and technologies that depict the flow of data within and between technology systems and business functions/operations. </li></ul><p><br></p>Lawson Products is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.
industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: Business Intelligence (BI) Developer
description: Our client is looking for a  100% remote - Microsoft Engineer for a 6 month (chance to extend) contract engagement.  <br><br> Top Skills' Details <br><ul><li> Experience with Intune + Microsoft Endpoint Privilege Management</li><li> Experience with MSFT Patching configurations</li><li> Moving off AD on premise to Azure</li><li> Windows experience - OS, managing 3rd party for Windows devices<br><br></li></ul> Job Description <br><br>Client is continuing to grow through Acquisitions. They are seeking expertise in Intune/EPM to help with MSFT patching configurations, OS and 3rd party for Windows Devices.<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Need someone who has done this work before. There will be little to no hand holding and they need this resource to hit the ground running.<br><ul><li>Depending on skill level of this individual the duration may extend beyond the initial 6 months, if the workload is there.<br><br></li></ul> Employee Value Proposition (EVP) <br><br>Excited project to work with a new tool within Microsoft and be able to work with a highly collaborative and friendly team environment. Contractors are treated with respect and your opinion is valued.<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Data Warehouse Developer
description: <strong>Company Overview<br><br></strong>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<br><br>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<br><br>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<br><br><strong>Department Overview<br><br></strong>The Sales Enablement organization leads the strategy, development, and delivery of sales tools and processes that enable an efficient, effective selling organization. We develop the tools our sellers and pre-sale teams use to drive sales efficiency in reporting, forecasting, quoting, proposal delivery and more every day. Our mission is to build the best set of tools, data, and processes that will enable our Worldwide Sales organization to pursue continuous sales growth.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The Google Applications developer role will deploy and support sales tools within Google Suite applications that enable our sellers to create customer-facing selling documents quickly. In this role, you will be the primary developer for these applications, designing and implementing features based on input from multiple teams within Motorola Solutions.<br><br>Responsibilities include but are not limited to:<br><ul><li>Develop and support tools for creating standardized documents in a Google Docs environment</li><li>Complete complex program changes to translate requirement specifications into code</li><li>Develop and test technical design</li><li>Apply application specific technical skills to independently produce deliverables, including programming changes, test scripts, and documentation</li><li>Acquire and utilize more in-depth user and business knowledge to support the applications</li><li>Plan, document, and execute test plans to ensure code meets specifications</li><li>Perform programming changes during user testing and post implementation to ensure the integrity of application</li><li>Respond to questions, and also research and resolve issues to provide technical support for production applications</li><li>Optimize and maintain code following initial completion<br><br></li></ul>Skills/Qualifications:<br><ul><li>2+ years of professional work experience as a programmer</li><li>OR Bachelor's degree in Computer Science</li><li>Experience with HTML, JavaScript, and/or Google Script strongly desirable</li><li>Knowledge of user interface design and web design constraints</li><li>Knowledge of content management processes</li><li>Strong communication and presentation skills</li><li>Experience coding add-ons to Google desktop publishing applications, such as Google Docs or Google Sheets</li><li>Experience in SOAP based web services and Rest APIs</li><li>Experience coding with any of the following languages is a plus: XML, Visual Basic, C#</li><li>Salesforce Experience a plus<br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>2+ years of professional work experience as a programmer</li><li>OR Bachelor's degree<br><br></li></ul><strong>Travel Requirements<br><br></strong>Under 10%<br><br><strong>Relocation Provided<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Position Type<br><br></strong>New Grad<br><br><strong>Referral Payment Plan<br><br></strong>No<br><br><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:<br></strong><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!<br><br></li></ul><em><strong>EEO Statement<br><br></strong></em>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.<br><br>

title: *100% Remote* Microsoft Engineer
description: <p><strong>Role: Jr Endpoint Security Engineer</strong></p><p><strong>Job Description:</strong></p><p>Responsible for IT Security &amp; Cybersecurity Services for networks and endpoints</p><p>Responsible for reducing the enterprise’s risk by monitoring and coordinating with vendors for endpoint protection tools.</p><p>Secure company endpoints devices such as desktops, tablets, servers, mobile devices, etc.</p><p>Responsible for upholding the security posture of all endpoints</p><p>Provide 8 x 5 support (eastern) and on-call support for endpoint security tools</p><p>Partner with Client IT team on endpoint security tools and configuration changes and upgrades</p><p>Support the SOC and incident response teams on resolving endpoint security incidents</p><p>Triage Security Incidents reported by endpoint security tools and take necessary action to resolve/mitigate security issues</p><p>Proactively monitor the dashboard, logs in security tools and implement preventive measures</p><p>Provide support for Regulatory and Security Audits</p><p>Maintain application allow and deny list for endpoints (e.g. ThreatLocker)</p><p><strong>Required Skills:</strong></p><p>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Cyber Security, or a directly related field</p><p>5+ years working/managing Endpoint Security at the medium level organization (1500+ endpoints)</p><p>Experience using ThreatLocker and Arctic Wolf MDR or similar tools for endpoint protection and MDR solutions</p><p>Experience implementing and managing endpoint DLP solutions</p><p>Experience implementing and managing EDR/EPP (Crowdstrike, ThreatLocker)</p><p>Experience in endpoint protection approaches and technologies</p><p>Experience with securing Office 365, Azure AD, and Email</p><p>Working knowledge of Microsoft Endpoint Tools (InTune, Defender, DLP, etc.), MDM, UIEM</p><p><strong>Nice to Have Skills:</strong></p><p>Experience using tools such as ThreatLocker and Arctic Wolf MDR Services</p><p>Cyber Security Certification (CISSP, CISM, Security+, CEH, Azure Security Engineer, GIAC)</p><p>Experience in Threat Hunting</p><p>Experience in Insider Threat Detection</p>

title: Google Applications Developer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Day to Day Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Deploy and configure the PAM solution, including CyberArk and associated modules, to establish a secure and centralized platform for managing privileged accounts. Their current environment is all on prem and they are moving to the cloud in July utilizing services from CyberArk.</li><li>Establish robust monitoring capabilities within the PAM solution to track and audit privileged access activities.</li><li>Integrate across various systems including ServiceNow</li><li>Serve as a subject matter expert in PAM technologies, providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance for any PAM-related issues.</li><li>Conduct root cause analysis and implement corrective actions to ensure system availability and performance.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional IT teams, including system administrators, network engineers, and application developers, to integrate the PAM solution seamlessly into existing infrastructure and applications.</li><li>Act as a liaison between security, IAM, and development teams to ensure consistent security practices.</li><li>Support security and compliance initiatives by participating in audits, vulnerability assessments, and penetration tests.</li><li>Remediate identified vulnerabilities and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry best practices.</li><li>Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of PAM configurations, processes, and procedures.</li><li>Prepare reports and presentations to communicate the status of the PAM environment.</li><li>Stay abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in PAM and privileged access security.</li><li>Evaluate new tools, techniques, and features to enhance our PAM capabilities and drive continuous improvement.</li><li>Conjur experience is a plus as they are looking to implement in the next 1-2 years.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills, Abilities And Behaviors Required</u></strong><p><br></p>Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.<p><br></p>Strong knowledge and experience with PAM solutions, such title: Python Developer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $100 – $112/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualifications that will make you successful in this role:<br></strong><ul><li>Working knowledge of Google Cloud Platform services such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Run</li><li>Python - Minimum 3 years, preferably 4-5</li><li>Analytics SQL - Ability to perform analysis and understand how to query output data<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualities that will help you thrive in this role: <br></strong><ul><li>You are willing to work with and improve code you did not originally write, primarily in Python and deployed in Cloud Run</li><li>You have some experience creating dashboards in tools such as Looker to derive insights from data stored in BigQuery tables</li><li>You are familiar with building and monitoring cloud services and infrastructure</li><li>You understand that being an effective software engineer is about communicating with people as much as it is about writing code</li><li>You can tackle unconstrained problems and know when to seek help</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>What’s the role?<br><br></strong>Our client's Data Enablement organization's mission is to enable the use of data at scale and to unlock learning through experimentation. As part of the Data Governance &amp; Privacy team, you will join a highly visible team with a top priority of protecting sensitive information of our client's buyers and sellers. The team is responsible for building services and processes to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in their data warehouses. You'll be part of their journey to modernize how they protect personal data.<br><br>They work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Run, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Languages include Java, Python, PHP and SQL, and they work with technologies like Terraform, Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. Experience with any of these is helpful; above all, they value curiosity, responsibility, and eagerness to solve complex engineering problems. They're looking for a flexible engineer, who can work with their internal customers, and embraces pivoting to the appropriate tool for the job rather than having deep expertise in single systems.<br><br>For this role, they are considering remote candidates. Their team is geographically dispersed, but work in North American Time Zones.<br><br><strong>What does the day-to-day look like?<br><br></strong>Our client is seeking a Senior Software Engineer to help deliver on two tracks of work<br><br>First, to help us analyze and audit Google Cloud Storage data to ensure security and compliance, they are building an inventory of our client's GCS file sets across Etsy’s hundreds of projects and thousands of buckets. They have performed a proof of concept of Google’s Storage Insight inventory report feature and moving to productionalize<br><ul><li>You will lead the development of automating the process of configuring Storage Insights features across thousands of buckets and ensure it scales well</li><li>You will use your knowledge of Cloud Storage including Cloud Audit Logs and Pub/Sub notifications to automate bucket discovery</li><li>You will use Cloud Run to automate processing data transformation on the inventory metadata</li><li>You will participate in meetings with Google technical leads to collaborate on feature request and issue resolution for Storage Insights, as this is an evolving feature Google is building<br><br></li></ul>Second, they are modernizing how they identify and protect PII data in their BigQuery tables. They are working to create standard for Column Tags and Policy Tags with the goal of automating PII data protection<br><ul><li>You will work with your team to develop methods to programmatically apply column tags and Policy Tags on BigQuery data sets to identify and protect Personally Identifiable Information</li><li>You will use your knowledge of Python to develop the endpoints of services responsible for automating adding of column tags and policy tags to BigQuery tables<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6684<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Python Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>Discover Financial Services (DFS) is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in the U.S. The company has an outstanding opportunity in its highly visible Corporate Risk Management (CRM) department for a <strong>Senior Specialist, Data Science</strong> with experience in analytics and programming skills required for managing Model Risk in financial services organization.<p><br></p>This highly visible role within the Automation and Analytics team of MRM is responsible for working closely with management to develop applications that automate and aid in analyzing business processes. This position will closely monitor performance metrics and KPIs to ensure goals are met and course correction is pursued as necessary.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops back-end components to automate and improve efficiency of business processes; develops and automates reports; iteratively builds reporting dashboards to provide analytical insights.</li><li>Operates as a subject matter expert in developing applications and collaborates within the team to integrate user-facing elements into programming applications (such as Python, R, VBA, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML), improve functionality of existing systems, assess and prioritize feature requests (experience with Shiny is a plus).</li><li>Performs independent financial model validations; writes and presents validation results to model stakeholders.</li><li>Researches new techniques such as machine learning/AI potentials in model risk management process</li><li>Consistently follows standard work processes and documentation requirements. Recommends improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining quality of work. Continuously improves technical and leadership skills through training and development</li><li>Queries data from multiple sources and platforms (SAS, Teradata, Essbase, Excel, and others) to find the right information for the problems.</li><li>Interprets model-validation test results and establishes required action plans with model owners and developers.</li><li>Maintains and enhances the enterprise-wide model inventory. Maintains working papers and records of model-validation results.</li><li>Reads model documentation, researches modeling methodology and framework, and digs deeply into data, asks the right question to learn about the modeling process and techniques, identifies model limitations, and recommends future action.</li><li>Builds benchmark models when necessary, using the best-practice approach in the appropriate areas.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master's Degree in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, or related quantitative field</li><li>2+ years of experience in model development and/or validation experience in a financial services industry, or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years of experience in model development and/or validation experience in a financial services industry, or related field</li><li>2+ years experience as a python developer, or expertise in at least one popular python framework (like Django, Flask or Pyramid)</li></ul><p><br></p>@li-cs1<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $63,500.00 to $107,100.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>Discover Financial Services (DFS) is a direct banking and payment services company with one of the most recognized brands in the U.S. The company has an outstanding opportunity in its highly visible Corporate Risk Management (CRM) department for a <strong>Senior Specialist, Data Science</strong> with experience in analytics and programming skills required for managing Model Risk in financial services organization.<p><br></p>This highly visible role within the Automation and Analytics team of MRM is responsible for working closely with management to develop applications that automate and aid in analyzing business processes. This position will closely monitor performance metrics and KPIs to ensure goals are met and course correction is pursued as necessary.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops back-end components to automate and improve efficiency of business processes; develops and automates reports; iteratively builds reporting dashboards to provide analytical insights.</li><li>Operates as a subject matter expert in developing applications and collaborates within the team to integrate user-facing elements into programming applications (such as Python, R, VBA, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML), improve functionality of existing systems, assess and prioritize feature requests (experience with Shiny is a plus).</li><li>Performs independent financial model validations; writes and presents validation results to model stakeholders.</li><li>Researches new techniques such as machine learning/AI potentials in model risk management process</li><li>Consistently follows standard work processes and documentation requirements. Recommends improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining quality of work. Continuously improves technical and leadership skills through training and development</li><li>Queries data from multiple sources and platforms (SAS, Teradata, Essbase, Excel, and others) to find the right information for the problems.</li><li>Interprets model-validation test results and establishes required action plans with model owners and developers.</li><li>Maintains and enhances the enterprise-wide model inventory. Maintains working papers and records of model-validation results.</li><li>Reads model documentation, researches modeling methodology and framework, and digs deeply into data, asks the right question to learn about the modeling process and techniques, identifies model limitations, and recommends future action.</li><li>Builds benchmark models when necessary, using the best-practice approach in the appropriate areas.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master's Degree in Statistics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, or related quantitative field</li><li>2+ years of experience in model development and/or validation experience in a financial services industry, or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4+ years of experience in model development and/or validation experience in a financial services industry, or related field</li><li>2+ years experience as a python developer, or expertise in at least one popular python framework (like Django, Flask or Pyramid)</li></ul><p><br></p>@li-cs1<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $63,500.00 to $107,100.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Data/ Software Engineer - Freelance [Remote]
description: Skiltrek is looking for a Security Engineer with M365 and Windows/Linux server experience to join our team.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Assess the security posture of our systems, applications, and infrastructure and design and implement strategies for asset hardening (baseline security configurations). Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks.<p><br></p>Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices. Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams. Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets. Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption.<p><br></p>Software Requirements<p><br></p>Active Directory (Azure, On-prem)<p><br></p>AWS (Desirable)<p><br></p>M365<p><br></p>Windows Servers (2016 and newer)<p><br></p>Linux (Desirable)<p><br></p>Containers (Desirable)<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Required</u></strong><p><br></p>5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with experience in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security.<p><br></p>Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell<p><br></p>Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.<p><br></p>Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations.<p><br></p>Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS)<p><br></p>Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues.<p><br></p>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.<p><br></p>Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US.<p><br></p>At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances,<p><br></p>be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender,<p><br></p>race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

title: W2 Security Engineer
description: SYNERGISTICIT wants every Job seeker to be aware that the Job Market is Challenging and to stand out you need to have exceptional skills and technologies which make you stand out from other Job seekers.<br><br>If your skills and your project work are similar to others then it's difficult to stand out to the clients. Since 2010 we have helped Jobseekers stand out by ensuring only the best candidates with the requisite skillset go to the clients and get the attention that they need. We just don't focus on getting you a Job we make careers.<br><br>Position open for all visas and US citizens<br><br>We at SynergisticIT understand the problem of the mismatch between employer's requirements and Employee skills and that's why since 2010 we have helped thousands of candidates get jobs at technology clients like apple, google, Paypal, western union, Client, visa, Walmart labs, etc to name a few.<br><br>We have an excellent reputation with the clients. Currently, We are looking for entry-level software programmers, Java Full stack developers, Python/Java developers, and Data analysts/ Data Scientists.<br><br>Who Should Apply Recent Computer science/Engineering /Mathematics/Statistics or Science Graduates looking to make their careers in IT Industry.<br><br>We welcome candidates with all visas and citizens to apply.<br><br>We assist in filing for STEM extension and also for H1b and Green card filing to Candidates<br><br>Candidates who are serious about their future in the IT Industry and have set big goals for themselves.<br><br>Candidates having difficulty in finding jobs or cracking interviews or who want to improve their skill portfolio. We also offer Skill enhancement programs if the candidates are missing skills or experience which our clients need with great outcomes<br><br>Candidates can benefit from skill enhancement if they fall into the below categories. If they are qualified with enough skills then no need for skill enhancement<br><br><strong><u>Candidates Who Lack Experience<br><br></u></strong>Have had a break in careers<br><br>Lack Technical Competency<br><br>Different visa candidates who want to get employed and settle down in the USA<br><br>please also check the below links<br><br>If not a match candidates can opt for Skill enhancement<br><br>For getting help with interviews please visit<br><br><strong><u>REQUIRED SKILLS For Java /Software Programmers<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT<br><br>Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive<br><br>Experience in the programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle<br><br>Project work on the skills<br><br>Knowledge of Core Java, Javascript, C++, or software programming<br><br>Spring boot, Microservices, Docker, Jenkins, and REST API experience<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br><br>For data Science/Machine learning<br><br><strong><u>Required Skills<br><br></u></strong>Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Information Systems, IT<br><br>Project work on the technologies needed<br><br>Highly motivated, self-learner, and technically inquisitive<br><br>Experience in the programming language Java and understanding of the software development life cycle<br><br>Knowledge of Statistics, SAS, Python, Computer Vision, and data visualization tools<br><br>Excellent written and verbal communication skills<br><br>Preferred skills: NLP, Text mining, Tableau, Time series analysis<br><br>Please understand skills are required by clients for selection even if it's a Junior or entry-level position the additional skills and Project work are the only way a candidate can be picked by clients. If not having the above candidates can opt for skill enhancement to gain the required skills and project work.<br><br>No third-party candidates or c2c candidates<br><br>Please apply to the posting.<br><br>No phone calls please. Shortlisted candidates would be reached out.

title: W2 Security Engineer
description: There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.<p><br></p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Location:</strong> United States (US) - Illinois - Chicago<p><br></p><strong>Function:</strong> Technology (CA)<p><br></p><strong>Title: </strong>Software Engineer (Chicago, IL or Moline, IL) - 98009<p><br></p><strong>Onsite/Remote:</strong>Partial Remote Position<p><br></p>This position may be located in Chicago, IL or Moline, IL per the hiring manager's discretion. This may be dependent on the successful candidate's background, experience, and proficiency.<p><br></p><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As a <strong>Software Engineer</strong> for <strong>John Deere Finacial</strong> located in <strong>Chicago, IL or Moline, IL</strong>, you will...<p><br></p><ul><li> Work on a product team to develop and support critical features for John Deere data products </li><li> Evaluate, design, and implement solutions to improve cost, quality, and performance of data products </li><li> Work alongside other team members promoting a DevSecOps culture </li><li> Participate in data delivery and modernization initiatives for the product </li><li> Solve well-defined problems with little guidance </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>VISA Sponsorship is NOT available for this position.</strong><p><br></p><strong>What Skills You Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3 or more years of proven experience in the design, development, testing (TDD) and integration of high complex software solutions leveraging change management </li><li> 3 or more years of experience in full-stack development and designing loosely coupled API based systems </li><li> 3 or more years of experience designing and delivering Transactional, Warehouse, Analytical and Reporting Data Platforms leveraging modern cloud data technologies </li><li> 1 or more years of experience with Spark, SQL, data modeling, Java, and Spring Boot </li><li> 1 or more years of proven experience in an Agile/Scrum team environment </li><li> 1 or more years of proven experience leveraging DevSecOps and lean development principles such as Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery </li><li> 1 or more years of experience in cloud development with the AWS platform </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What Makes You Stand Out</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Capable of collaborating with multiple business stakeholders to provide information technology solutions </li><li> Proven experience working in a team environment, influence effectively, ability to resolve impediments in a timely manner </li><li> Learning Agility / Innovative – desire and openness for continuous technical learning and identifying areas for application </li><li> Growth mindest – willingness to deal and thrive in uncertainty </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science or Engineering </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Get</strong><p><br></p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive reward package to help you get started on your new career path, including:<p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible work arrangements</li><li>Highly competitive base pay and performance bonuses</li><li>Savings &amp; Retirement benefits (401K and Defined Benefit Pension)</li><li>Healthcare benefits with a generous company contribution in the Health Savings Account</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Employee Assistance Programs</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</li><li>Charitable contribution match</li><li>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</li></ul><p><br></p>Follow this link to learn more about our Total Rewards Package https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL<p><br></p>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.<p><br></p>The terms of the applicable benefit plans, and all company actions administering or interpreting these plans, continue to control. Deere &amp; Company reserves the right to suspend, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan(s) in any manner at any time, including the right to modify or eliminate any cost-sharing between the company and participants. Changes, which can be made at any time, are made by action of the company's board of directors, or to the extent authorized by resolution of its board of directors, or by the Deere &amp; Company Compensation Committee. In the event of a conflict between the language of the official Plan Documents and this document, the language of the official Plan Documents will control.<p><br></p>ACA Section 1557 Nondiscrimination Notice<p><br></p>The John Deere Health Benefit Plans for Salaried Employees and The John Deere Benefit Plan for Wage Employees comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Location:</strong> United States (US) - Illinois - Chicago<p><br></p><strong>Function:</strong> Technology (CA)<p><br></p><strong>Title: </strong>Software Engineer (Chicago, IL or Moline, IL) - 98009<p><br></p><strong>Onsite/Remote:</strong>Partial Remote Position<p><br></p>This position may be located in Chicago, IL or Moline, IL per the hiring manager's discretion. This may be dependent on the successful candidate's background, experience, and proficiency.<p><br></p><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As a <strong>Software Engineer</strong> for <strong>John Deere Finacial</strong> located in <strong>Chicago, IL or Moline, IL</strong>, you will...<p><br></p><ul><li> Work on a product team to develop and support critical features for John Deere data products </li><li> Evaluate, design, and implement solutions to improve cost, quality, and performance of data products </li><li> Work alongside other team members promoting a DevSecOps culture </li><li> Participate in data delivery and modernization initiatives for the product </li><li> Solve well-defined problems with little guidance </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>VISA Sponsorship is NOT available for this position.</strong><p><br></p><strong>What Skills You Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3 or more years of proven experience in the design, development, testing (TDD) and integration of high complex software solutions leveraging change management </li><li> 3 or more years of experience in full-stack development and designing loosely coupled API based systems </li><li> 3 or more years of experience designing and delivering Transactional, Warehouse, Analytical and Reporting Data Platforms leveraging modern cloud data technologies </li><li> 1 or more years of experience with Spark, SQL, data modeling, Java, and Spring Boot </li><li> 1 or more years of proven experience in an Agile/Scrum team environment </li><li> 1 or more years of proven experience leveraging DevSecOps and lean development principles such as Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery </li><li> 1 or more years of experience in cloud development with the AWS platform </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What Makes You Stand Out</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Capable of collaborating with multiple business stakeholders to provide information technology solutions </li><li> Proven experience working in a team environment, influence effectively, ability to resolve impediments in a timely manner </li><li> Learning Agility / Innovative – desire and openness for continuous technical learning and identifying areas for application </li><li> Growth mindest – willingness to deal and thrive in uncertainty </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Ideally, you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science or Engineering </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Get</strong><p><br></p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive reward package to help you get started on your new career path, including:<p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible work arrangements</li><li>Highly competitive base pay and performance bonuses</li><li>Savings &amp; Retirement benefits (401K and Defined Benefit Pension)</li><li>Healthcare benefits with a generous company contribution in the Health Savings Account</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Employee Assistance Programs</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</li><li>Charitable contribution match</li><li>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</li></ul><p><br></p>Follow this link to learn more about our Total Rewards Package https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL<p><br></p>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.<p><br></p>The terms of the applicable benefit plans, and all company actions administering or interpreting these plans, continue to control. Deere &amp; Company reserves the right to suspend, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan(s) in any manner at any time, including the right to modify or eliminate any cost-sharing between the company and participants. Changes, which can be made at any time, are made by action of the company's board of directors, or to the extent authorized by resolution of its board of directors, or by the Deere &amp; Company Compensation Committee. In the event of a conflict between the language of the official Plan Documents and this document, the language of the official Plan Documents will control.<p><br></p>ACA Section 1557 Nondiscrimination Notice<p><br></p>The John Deere Health Benefit Plans for Salaried Employees and The John Deere Benefit Plan for Wage Employees comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex.

title: Software Engineer (Chicago, IL or Moline, IL)
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Assess the security posture of our systems, applications, and infrastructure and design and implement strategies for asset hardening (baseline security configurations). Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks. Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices. Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams. Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets. Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption. Software Requirements Active Directory (Azure, On-prem) AWS (Desirable) M365 Windows Servers (2016 and newer) Linux (Desirable) Containers (Desirable) Experience Required 5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with a demonstrated background in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security. Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell Knowledge, Skills, ablilties, and behaviors required Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision. Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations. Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS) Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues. Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>security, information security, firewall, network security, cloud<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>security,information security,firewall,network security,cloud<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Education Requirements 4 year college degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, MS500, MS-700, CCSP, etc.) preferred<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>Intermediate Level<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US.<p><br></p>At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances,<p><br></p>be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender,<p><br></p>race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.
