title: TECHNICAL BUSINESS ANALYST/FINANCIAL SYSTEMS
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Adobe Implementation Specialist, you will be part of DNA Marketing Technology team, serving teams that engage with customers and prospects throughout the customer journey, from acquisition marketing to portfolio collections to digital app experience across Discover. You will work with DNA Martech Engineers, Data collections product owners, Business stakeholders and Data Scientists to design, develop and implement technical tagging requirements for company web and mobile app platforms.<p><br></p>You will lead the design and implementation of MarTech solutions with a focus on Adobe Analytics, Adobe Launch and AEP. You will be a liaison between the Adobe Analytics analysts, launch implementation developers, and data layer developers, owning projects to ensure tagging is complete and accurate. You will have the opportunity to work on solutions that drive business value for improved analysis, storytelling, and customer journey development.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops and leads an Agile team focused on next-generation data and analytic technologies.</li><li>Provides technical consulting in support of the creation and enhancement of analytical platforms and tools.</li><li>Provides technical consulting to application development teams during application design and development for highly complex and critical data projects.</li><li>Partners on a team to deliver data projects, including migration to new data technologies for unstructured, streaming, and high-volume data.</li><li>Develops and deploys big data applications.</li><li>Builds and administers large scale data platforms. Integrates next-generation data analytic tools into the big data ecosystem.</li><li>Responsible for architecting, configuring, and administering an analytics infrastructure in partnership with Product, Design, and IT Development.</li><li>Debugs/troubleshoots/resolves Adobe configuration and integration issues.</li><li>Assess, audit and identify gaps in existing tagging, infrastructure and Adobe Launch configurations.</li><li>Develops and document Discover MarTech’s data collection standards and best practices.</li><li>Support implementation architecture strategy and governance</li><li>Develops instrumentation strategies across multiple websites &amp; mobile apps.</li><li>Provides guidance and mentorship to the development team to ensure high-quality code and adherence to coding standards.<br><br></li></ul><ul><li>Responsible for the following tasks:</li><ul><li>Tagging for both websites &amp; native mobile apps in enterprise-grade environments</li><li>Tagging schemas and specifications for new sites and new site features</li><li>Quality Assurance and debugging of tagging as implemented by engineers.</li><li>Data layer design and implementation</li><li>Writing tagging specifications for engineers.<br><br></li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or related field</li><li>2+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li><li>In lieu of a degree, 6+ years of experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>If we had our say, we’d also look for:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years’ Experience in Data Platform Administration, Engineering, or related field, with 4+ years on Adobe Analytics</li><li>Strong knowledge of tag management data collection platforms such as Adobe Launch, GTM etc.</li><li>The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the Adobe ecosystem, including Adobe Experience platform, Adobe Launch, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and Adobe Mobile SDK.</li><li>Must have hands-on experience in creating Analytics solutions design, implementation, and integrations.</li><li>Expert in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML</li><li>Strong knowledge of JavaScript and common libraries used in website building (e. g. jQquery, React).</li><li>Knowledge of considerations of analytics code and 3rd parties SDKs implementation in native mobile apps.</li><li>Be able to create SDR and convert it to exact script code to be added on page/app screens or user actions on page.</li><li>Experience with Real Time CDP Connections integration with AdTech products.</li><li>Knowledge of single page applications web analytics data collection integrations</li><li>Have solid analytics implementation experience across the life cycle and digital platforms (including web, responsive and native mobile apps) using Adobe/Google Analytics especially for complex eco-systems (multiple sites/apps, 100s of custom tags, multiple implementation techniques for main site/syndicate sites etc.)</li><li>Adobe Analytics Architect Master certificate.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

parties SDKs implementation in native mobile apps.</li><li>Be able to create SDR and convert it to exact script code to be added on page/app screens or user actions on page.</li><li>Experience with Real Time CDP Connections integration with AdTech products.</li><li>Knowledge of single page applications web analytics data collection integrations</li><li>Have solid analytics implementation experience across the life cycle and digital platforms (including web, responsive and native mobile apps) using Adobe/Google Analytics especially for complex eco-systems (multiple sites/apps, 100s of custom tags, multiple implementation techniques for main site/syndicate sites etc.)</li><li>Adobe Analytics Architect Master certificate.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $74,000.00 to $124,800.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. title: Security Engineer
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Research Analyst key responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python, R, or any other general-purpose programming language (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-ResearchAnalys.002<p><br></p>

title: Security Engineer
description: <strong>Are you searching for a rewarding experience helping children and families reach their goals and full potential? If you are passionate about improving the lives of children and adolescents on the autism spectrum, apply now! Key Autism is hiring motivated and passionate professionals, both experienced and entry level to join our growing team! We provide an in-depth ABA training to assist with growth and knowledge of the field and providing impeccable services to our families.</strong><p><br></p><strong>We are looking for part time Behavior Therapist in Burbank!</strong><p><br></p><strong>Hourly payrate is $20 to $26 based on overall experience</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Behavior Therapist Job Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Provide one on one (1:1) in-home Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA) therapy</li><li>Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions</li><li>Conduct discrete trials, implement behavior support, and treatment plans</li><li>Work collaboratively with a BCBA (Board Certified Behavior Analyst) Supervisor to implement basic principles and teaching procedures of ABA therapy</li><li>Be responsive to the needs and requests of clients, their families and supervisors</li><li>Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work</li><li>Arrive on time and be prepared for therapy sessions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Growth Opportunities In The Field Of ABA</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible Schedules </li><li>Competitive hourly rates, incentive programs, and bonuses</li><li>A Rewarding Career: Helping kids achieve their goals!</li><li>Behavior Therapist New-Hire Skills Training </li><li>Tuition discount with our Partners! </li><li>RBT certification and aspiring BCBA program (Supervision and Mentoring)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Behavior Technician Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Education: High School Diploma or Bachelor's Degree (preferred), or RBT</li><li>Experience: Childcare, healthcare, or mental health</li><li>Dependability: Consistency and reliability s crucial for child's success</li><li>Integrity: You will work in the child's home without constant supervision</li><li>Positivity and Patience: It's all about positive reinforcement and repetition</li><li>Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication in English</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Physical Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to up to 35lbs. </li><li>Required to perform activities that entail fine and gross motor skills, bend, kneel, and squat, sitting on floor or in a chair, or standing for periods of time. </li><li>Ability to respond quickly in short distance (100 feet) in response to the movement and behaviors of children. </li><li>Willingness and ability to work in both indoor and outdoor settings.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Key Autism provides services to children and adults throughout the states of Massachusetts, Georgia, North Carolina, Florida, Colorado, Illinois, and Texas. Services include programs for children with Autism Spectrum Disorder and other related conditions. We have been serving families since 2014. At Key we work as compassionate partners with individuals, families, case managers and other professionals to provide the level of support needed to improve the lives of the clients we serve.<p><br></p>At Key Autism Services, all the autism treatment services we provide are guided by a common philosophy about the role of the family in a child's development. We strive to equip both the children and their families with necessary skills for strong, satisfying relationships with one another, because we know that learning happens best when it happens in the context of playful, reciprocal interactions with life partners.<p><br></p>We believe family is the foundation for a child's development. Family is the ever-present guiding force in a child's life from the first breath through all the growing-up years. Family doesn't close for the holidays, go on vacation or call it quits at five o'clock. Family remains a persistent presence on a day-in, day-out basis, through all the seasons of the year, through all the years of childhood.<p><br></p>Our team is committed to helping individuals and their families become self-sufficient and live as independently as their abilities allow. We hire compassionate, highly trained and dedicated individuals who show a passion to contribute their skills to make our client healthier and stronger.<p><br></p><strong><em>Check out more opportunities we have to offer! </em></strong>https://www.keyautismservices.com/careers/

title: Application Developer
description: <strong>Job TITLE: </strong>System Integration Engineer<br><br><strong><u>Job DESCRIPTION<br><br></u></strong><strong>The System Integration Engineer </strong>maintains, improves, and develops system integration solutions across internal applications, data repositories and third-party solutions.<strong> The System Integration Engineer will work closely with business and system analysts, IT leadership and third-party contacts to deliver and improve integration solutions for the organization.<br><br></strong><strong><u>Job RESPONSIBILITIES<br></u></strong><ul><li>Lead integration projects. Manage, design, develop, improve, verify, and support data integration solutions associated with Syspro ERP and custom Data Warehouse. This includes third-party Logistics (3PL) systems, Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), Amazon vendor and seller central, third-party Point of Sales systems, and Master Data Management</li><li>Design, develop, and maintain VB.NET integration solutions and custom web pages to manage integration errors</li><li>Design, develop, and maintain Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) packages to extract, transform, and load data between systems </li><li>Understand data and process flows to investigate, track, manage, communicate, and improve data issues across systems</li><li>Ensure data integration security and code management best practices</li><li>Daily monitoring and error handling of all integration solutions to ensure successful completion </li><li>Implement and maintain batch schedules using Microsoft Power Automate and Visual Cron; provide after-hours support when needed<br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge, SKILLS, AND Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>SQL development, SSIS, and ETL experience required</li><li>Experience with VB.NET and .NET framework required </li><li>Experience with SOAP Web Services and RESTful APIs required</li><li>Knowledge of basic data constructs (XML, JSON)</li><li>Prior ERP experience preferred</li><li>Manufacturing and distribution industry experience preferred</li><li>Experiences with GIT and Azure DevOps source code management preferred</li><li>EDI integration experience a plus</li><li>Must be able to manage multiple work items at one time with a high sense of urgency.</li><li>Strong written and verbal communication skills. Proven ability to collaborate and communicate well with team members and stakeholders </li><li>Must possess strong problem solving and organizational skills<br></li></ul><strong>EDUCATION:</strong> Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience<br><br><strong>EXPERIENCE:</strong> 5 - 10 years of custom integration development experience<br><br><strong>WORK LOCATION:</strong> Gurnee, Illinois<br><br><strong>Employment Status:</strong> Full Time<br><br><strong>Travel required:</strong> N/A

title: Adobe Implementation Specialist
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The Cyber Security Operations (CSO) function within Global Information Security is responsible for all aspects of threat intelligence and monitoring, application and network security, and insider threat. In addition, the CSO team drives out the enterprise-wide cyber exercise program. As a Mainframe Batch Specialist, you would be an individual contributor responsible for providing operational and procedural support to provision and maintain Access for employees across the Enterprise, Mainframe platforms. A risk-oriented perspective is required, along with the ability to support BAU processes and maintenance of Enterprise Access platforms. You will be using your analytical mindset and teamwork skills to support and improve the Access Service experience. You will utilize your technical and business knowledge to support secure, risk-based practices, exercising judgment within broadly defined practices and policies. We look for you to be result-oriented, business focused, and successful at interfacing across multiple organizational units, at various levels. The knowledge/experience/exposure with information security topics, including the design, development, testing, implementation or governance of information security practices and solutions, will be very helpful in this role. You should be prepared to demonstrate your knowledge of access management/risk identification and mitigation/project management skills.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>racf, acf2, mainframe<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>racf,acf2,mainframe<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Additional Qualifications: Previous experience in Information Technology / Information Security / Identity and Access Management Proficient in Windows, Mainframe access provisioning and security systems would be a plus. Ability to identify, analyze and address problems to resolve issues whenever possible in way that minimizes negative impact and risk to the organization Ability to work independently on initiatives with little oversight. Motivated and willing to learn. Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual thinking. Ability to be comfortable delivering messages across a wide spectrum of individuals having varying degrees of technical understanding Strong leadership skills and qualities which enable you to work with peers and various levels of management Quick learner and self-starter Strong analytical thinking and problem solver Proven ability of risk oriented approach Good interpersonal and communication skills<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>Intermediate Level<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US.<p><br></p>At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances,<p><br></p>be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender,<p><br></p>race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

We look for you to be result-oriented, business focused, and successful at interfacing across multiple organizational units, at various levels. The knowledge/experience/exposure with information security topics, including the design, development, testing, implementation or governance of information security practices and solutions, will be very helpful in this role. You should be prepared to demonstrate your knowledge of access management/risk identification and mitigation/project management skills.<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>racf, acf2, mainframe<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>racf,acf2,mainframe<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Additional Qualifications: Previous experience in Information Technology / Information Security / Identity and Access Management Proficient in Windows, Mainframe access provisioning and security systems would be a plus. Ability to identify, analyze and address problems to resolve issues whenever possible in way that minimizes negative impact and risk to the organization Ability to work independently on initiatives with little oversight. Motivated and willing to learn. Strong analytical skills/problem solving/conceptual thinking. Ability to be comfortable delivering messages across a wide spectrum of individuals having varying degrees of technical understanding Strong leadership skills and qualities which enable you to work with peers and various levels of management Quick learner and self-starter Strong analytical thinking and problem solver Proven ability of risk oriented approach Good interpersonal and communication skills<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>Intermediate Level<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Skiltrek is an award-winning IT staffing firm and the staffing partner of choice for many leading companies across the US.<p><br></p>At Skiltrek, we promise you the perfect opportunity of building technical excellence, understand business performance and nuances,<p><br></p>be abreast with the latest happenings in technology world and enjoy a satisfying work life balance.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender,<p><br></p>race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law.<p><br></p>Skiltrek is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

title: Research Analyst, gt.school (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Provides technical support to field engineers, technicians, and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging complex electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, complex software, or networked and/or wireless systems.<br><br>Responds to situations where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. Reports design, reliability, and maintenance problems or bugs to design engineering/software engineering. May be involved in customer installation and training.<br><br>Provides support to customers/users where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in nature.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br></strong><ul><li>Services Window: 9*5</li><li>After office hours on call support will be provided for priority tickets. </li><li>Location: Gurgaon office</li><li>Resident Engineer will have minimum 3 years of experience along with relevant security monitoring experience NAC, EDR, WAF, NIPS, Anti-APT, Antivirus etc solution</li><li>He should have knowledge on monitoring tool i.e SolarWinds etc. </li><li>He should have knowledge on VMC vulnerability management</li><li>He should have knowledge on compliance management. </li><li>He should have any basic security certification i.e CompTIA+ security, CCNA Security etc<br><br></li></ul><strong>1.2 Scope for onsite Resource:<br></strong><ul><li>Provide business hours support within defined SBI Card SLA of incident/change/problem management. </li><li>Provide L1 support for IT security incidents and incidents related to security components. </li><li>Track and monitor incidents surfaced from internal &amp; external attacks. title: System Integration Engineer
description: This individual will be part of the development group with main responsibilities for developing and maintaining systems and tools for post trade reporting and analysis. Working with the state-of-the-art proprietary technologies and our Compliance department you will be responsible for analyzing trends and anomalies and building data reporting services.<p><br></p>If you are a tech-savvy individual who enjoys the challenges of solving difficult technical problems in a fast-paced, energetic environment, then this is the role for you.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop tools to assist in the review and analysis of trading activity that involves Big Data.</li><li>Maintain the current and develop a new infrastructure and surveillance reporting to respond to data requests. </li><li>Develop and implement procedures so that the data is maintained to stay consistent with regulatory data retention requirements. </li><li>Ownership over the daily functionalities of various databases and monitoring systems. </li><li>Work alongside Core Development and Risk to ensure all systems are compliant and identify opportunities to efficiently maintain and query data. </li><li>Other duties as assigned or needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills You’ll Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong communication skills</li><li>Strong scripting skills using Python or equivalent</li><li>Programming skills, C++ preferred</li><li>Experience with Splunk</li><li>Experience with Django or other web development tools</li><li>Experience with SQL, relational databases, and ODBC</li><li>Experience with ETL tools helpful.</li><li>Familiarity with Finra/SEC reporting rules is a plus</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or its equivalent.</li><li>Reliable and predictable availability </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Discretionary bonus eligibility</li><li> Medical, dental, and vision insurance</li><li> HSA, FSA, and Dependent Care options</li><li> Employer Paid Group Term Life and AD&amp;D Insurance</li><li> Voluntary Life &amp; AD&amp;D insurance</li><li> Paid vacation plus paid holidays</li><li> Retirement plan with employer match</li><li> Paid parental leave</li><li> Wellness Programs</li></ul><p><br></p>Annual Base Salary Range<p><br></p>$150,000—$200,000 USD

description: <ul><li>Fullstack opportunity using C#,.NET, React with collaborative team environment|Be a part of a cross-functional, full stack agile development team<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is a predominantly credit focused investment management firm that has been around for over 2 decades. They are a nice, family friendly firm rooted in philanthropy and giving back to the community. Their culture and investment process are rooted in three defining principles: rigorous fundamental analysis, strong risk management, and ongoing portfolio optimization.<br><br>Our client is based in Chicago and have assets under management of approximately $5 billion. Our client recently was acquired by a new entity, and they will be the investment manager for all assets going into this entity. This will lead them to growth of approx. $40 billion in assets under management, and the largest minority owned financial firm in the world.<br><br><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Work with stakeholders to identify and analyze business requirements, develop solutions, and create technical designs.</li><li>Provide technical guidance and leadership to the junior members of the data analytics team, ensuring that the solutions are built according to best practices.</li><li>Own and improve the data platform architecture</li><li>Evaluate new technologies and integrate them into our infrastructure</li><li>Lead the design of improved data flows, data architecture, and data solutions</li><li>Help build out a secure and highly available data system to scale</li><li>Help create and build front office data analytics tools and automation processes<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree or above in Computer Science or related field</li><li>At least 4+ years of experience as a Software Developer / Engineer</li><li>Strong experience with Java and C#/ .NET</li><li>Development experience Spring framework, Angular, React.</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong><ul><li>Top of the market salary, ranging from $120k-$165 based upon experience</li><li>Excellent total comp package with benefits</li><li>401k match, and Health-care / Medical Insurances</li><li>Very generous PTO, sick, mental and holiday time-off<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong>Please feel free to email your updated resume and a summary of your relevant experience to JordanKurth @ MichaelPage.US.com<br><br><strong>Contact: Jordan Kurth<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6075917</strong>

title: Mainframe Enginneer
description: <strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>We are PEAK6, a leading investment firm. You'll find us headquartered in the historic Chicago Board of Trade building, where we first opened our doors in 1997. It's been over 20 years since we were one of the first firms to develop sophisticated proprietary technology to use in our trading business. Today, we continue to leverage our technical ingenuity and operational excellence across several investment areas, spanning early-to-mid stage growth capital, operational control, trading, and e-sports, while always proving value to the customer. Throughout the years, we've built and operated several financial technology firms, and we continue to evolve. You'll find a bit of everything here, and we're always looking to take on new endeavors.<br><br><strong>Who We Need<br><br></strong>Technology Experience builds state-of-the-art people-centric solutions that transform and accelerate the PEAK6 Family of Brands. We operate important technology systems efficiently and securely while providing reliable products, services and data-driven analytics. We deliver a unified technology experience throughout the PEAK6 Family of Brands tailored where necessary to fit each business.<br><br>As a <strong>Cloud Systems Administrator</strong> in Technology Experience, you will be instrumental in the experience of all our employees throughout the PEAK6 Family of Brands. We’re looking for someone who takes ownership of their work, is resourceful in their problem-solving skills and is able to think creatively. You will be responsible for day-to-day maintenance, administration, and support of multiple SaaS solutions within Technology Experience. You will take on projects that will require clear communication and completion in a timely manner. We want someone who has a passion for setting the performance bar and thrives in an energetic team environment, while delivering a fully integrated solution that fits into one unified technology stack.<br><br>PEAK6 Technology Experience places emphasis on delivering white-glove customer service. Therefore, it is imperative for the Cloud Systems Administrator to place value on detail; but also, pair this with a sense of urgency for execution. Technology Experience is looking for people who have compassion and empathy for their teammates and a natural IT intuition who can work harder, faster and smarter while taking technical excellence to a whole new level.<br><br>This is a hybrid role which can be based out of PEAK6's Chicago, IL or Austin, TX offices. Hybrid at PEAK6 means an average of 3 days in office per week with 2 flexible work from home days per week.<br><br>You’ll be responsible for <strong>:<br></strong><ul><li>Manage and implement great experiences using our SaaS and cloud platform.</li><li>Primary contact person for troubleshooting cloud offerings.</li><li>Assist with implementation of integrations between critical technology solutions into our SaaS offering.</li><li>In collaboration with team members and leadership, implement great support processes, procedures, and documentation.</li><li>Identify opportunities for business enablement through smart use of technology.</li><li>Manage SaaS integrations through industry-standard best practices.</li><li>Manage, support, and provision business applications in a cloud-based environment.</li><li>Write clear, concise documentation for team members in wiki tools (Confluence).</li><li>Evaluate and recommend new software platforms and services.<br><br></li></ul>You’ll gain loads of experience in this role but before you do, you should have <strong>:<br></strong><ul><li>3+ years of experience supporting cloud/SaaS products.</li><li>Experience utilizing tools like Postman to manage APIs to integrate custom solutions from SaaS offerings such as Okta.</li><li>Experience with Cloud compute platforms such as AWS, GCP, and Azure.</li><li>Experience with administrating Office365, including comprehensive knowledge of all applications and services within, including OneDrive and SharePoint.</li><li>Experience with managing IDM solutions.</li><li>Experience with Atlassian tools such as Confluence and Jira.</li><li>Experience with Video Conferencing solutions such as Zoom.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal communication skills.</li><li>Experience administering ticketing platforms.<br><br></li></ul>

Hybrid at PEAK6 means an average of 3 days in office per week with 2 flexible work from home days per week.<br><br>You’ll be responsible for <strong>:<br></strong><ul><li>Manage and implement great experiences using our SaaS and cloud platform.</li><li>Primary contact person for troubleshooting cloud offerings.</li><li>Assist with implementation of integrations between critical technology solutions into our SaaS offering.</li><li>In collaboration with team members and leadership, implement great support processes, procedures, and documentation.</li><li>Identify opportunities for business enablement through smart use of technology.</li><li>Manage SaaS integrations through industry-standard best practices.</li><li>Manage, support, and provision business applications in a cloud-based environment.</li><li>Write clear, concise documentation for team members in wiki tools (Confluence).</li><li>Evaluate and recommend new software platforms and services.<br><br></li></ul>You’ll gain loads of experience in this role but before you do, you should have <strong>:<br></strong><ul><li>3+ years of experience supporting cloud/SaaS products.</li><li>Experience utilizing tools like Postman to manage APIs to integrate custom solutions from SaaS offerings such as Okta.</li><li>Experience with Cloud compute platforms such as AWS, GCP, and Azure.</li><li>Experience with administrating Office365, including comprehensive knowledge of all applications and services within, including OneDrive and SharePoint.</li><li>Experience with managing IDM solutions.</li><li>Experience with Atlassian tools such as Confluence and Jira.</li><li>Experience with Video Conferencing solutions such as Zoom.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal communication skills.</li><li>Experience administering ticketing platforms.<br><br></li></ul>

title: MS Engineer (L1)
description: Are you passionate about mitigating risk and ensuring compliance? Do you have an eye for detail and love digging into data to uncover potential issues? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! As the AML Analyst for our client’s U.S. Commercial Know Your Customer (KYC) team, you will play a crucial role in supporting compliance for our U.S. Commercial Bank lines of business. You will work directly with the banking and sales teams, as well as the U.S. AML Office and High Risk Unit, to gather required documents and data, assess customer AML risk, and generate AML KYC Checklists.<br><ul><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Respond to onboarding and update requests from Commercial Banking and TPS Sales teams.</li><li>Gather required customer AML data and enter it into the AML book of record system (CMCIF) to create or update KYC Checklists.</li><li>Review deal files, third party websites, and system information to augment data.</li><li>Adjudicate hits on any system name searches by consulting with internal OFAC Unit.</li><li>Work with the U.S. AML Office High Risk Unit to assess and update high-risk ratings as needed.</li><li>Accurately maintain Livelink folders, scanning all current information.</li><li>Complete clients’ AML annual reviews, drafting revised KYC Checklists, and requesting approval from RM and TPS Sales representatives.</li><li>Advise lines of business regarding AML information and documentation requirements.</li><li>Serve as the main point of contact for status updates on AML processing.</li><li>Accurately and thoroughly complete final KYC Checklist and electronic storage of all related supporting documentation.</li><li>Manage several requests simultaneously, prioritizing as needed.</li><li>Conduct peer quality assurance reviews.</li><li>Interact with staff of all levels in U.S. Commercial Banking and the U.S. AML Office High Risk Unit for issue resolution or escalation.</li><li>Maintain up-to-date subject matter expertise in the areas of AML and banking regulations.</li><li>Assist the Team Leader with training and act as a “go-to” person for less experienced Analysts.</li><li>Identify any gaps, issues, and best practices and raise them to the management team.</li><li>Requirements:*</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or related field.</li><li>Strong analytical and communication skills.</li><li>Knowledge of banking regulations and compliance requirements.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple requests simultaneously and prioritize as needed.</li><li>Attention to detail and accuracy.</li><li>Beginner understanding of French is a plus!<br><br></li></ul>About Aston Carter:<br><br>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<br><br>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: Salesforce Commerce Cloud Developer
description: There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about at John Deere. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! Here the world's brightest minds are tackling the world's biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we'll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.<p><br></p>John Deere is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to, among other things, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Location:</strong> United States (US) - Illinois - Chicago<p><br></p><strong>Function:</strong> Technology (CA)<p><br></p><strong>Title: </strong>Software Engineer - 96235<p><br></p><strong>Onsite/Remote:</strong>Partial Remote Position<p><br></p>This position is eligible for a flexible work schedule arrangement at the present time. The arrangement may be delayed for training or other job acclimation purposes and remains subject to change.<p><br></p><strong>Your Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>As a <strong>Software Engineer </strong>in the <strong>Cost Forecasting and Tracking</strong> team within Supply Chain Solutions in <strong>Moline or Chicago, IL</strong>, you will deliver modernized web-based applications used to forecast changes in material costs and track cost reductions across Enterprise Supply Management. Additionally, applications within the product facilitate the quoting sourcing of materials externally and integrate with SAP Engineering systems. The solutions within the product are used both internally by John Deere personnel, and externally by suppliers around the world. In addition, you will:<p><br></p><ul><li> Perform development and implementation of technical solutions to deliver on User Stories </li><li> Assist in resolution of IT technical issues in the product team. </li><li> Establish and implement CI/CD pipelines. </li><li> Develop automated test scripts. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>VISA Sponsorship is not available for this position</strong><p><br></p><strong>What Skills You Need</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Ability to analyze, translate, and define business requirements into technical solutions. </li><li> 3 or more years of experience with Java web development with Spring and RESTful APIs or Rest/SOAP based services. </li><li> 2 or more years of varied DB experience (e.g. DBS, SQL Server, MongoDB, Hibernate, NoSQL, MySql, DB2,SAP Hana) </li><li> Ability to apply engineering principles and concepts for designs. </li><li> Ability to manage many competing priorities/requests in a fast-paced environment. </li><li> 3 or more years of experience with TDD and acceptance test-driven development utilizing jUnit, Cucumber, Cypress, Puppeteer etc. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What Makes You Stand Out</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 1 or more years of experience with DevOps principles and lean development such as Continuous Integration (e.g. GitHub) and Continuous Delivery (Jenkins, Active Control etc.) </li><li> Working understanding of design patterns and loosely coupled architectures. </li><li> 1 or more years of experience with NodeJS, ReactJS, Redux. </li><li> Experience in cloud development with platforms like AWS or Azure. </li><li> Understanding of Supply Management processes. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Ideally you will have a degree or equivalent related work experience in the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in IT/Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You'll Get</strong><p><br></p>At John Deere, you are empowered to create a career that will take you to where you want to go while working in an inclusive team environment. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to think outside the box and the advanced tools and technology that foster innovation and achievement. Additionally, we offer a comprehensive reward package to help you get started on your new career path, including:<p><br></p><ul><li>Flexible work arrangements</li><li>Highly competitive base pay and performance bonuses</li><li>Savings &amp; Retirement benefits (401K and Defined Benefit Pension)</li><li>Healthcare benefits with a generous company contribution in the Health Savings Account</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Employee Assistance Programs</li><li>Tuition assistance</li><li>Fitness subsidies and on-site gyms at specific Deere locations</li><li>Charitable contribution match</li><li>Employee Purchase Plan &amp; numerous discount programs for personal use</li></ul><p><br></p>Follow this link to learn more about our Total Rewards Package https://bit.ly/3XCd8fL<p><br></p>The information contained herein is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and qualifications required of individuals performing the job. The qualifications detailed in this job description are not considered the minimum requirements necessary to perform the job, but rather as guidelines.<p><br></p>The terms of the applicable benefit plans, and all company actions administering or interpreting these plans, continue to control. Deere &amp; Company reserves the right to suspend, amend, modify, or terminate the Plan(s) in any manner at any time, including the right to modify or eliminate any cost-sharing between the company and participants. Changes, which can be made at any time, are made by action of the company's board of directors, or to the extent authorized by resolution of its board of directors, or by the Deere &amp; Company Compensation Committee. In the event of a conflict between the language of the official Plan Documents and this document, the language of the official Plan Documents will control.<p><br></p>ACA Section 1557 Nondiscrimination Notice<p><br></p>The John Deere Health Benefit Plans for Salaried Employees and The John Deere Benefit Plan for Wage Employees comply with applicable Federal civil rights laws and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex.

title: Software Engineer, Compliance
description: <ul><li>Software Engineering opportunity working in C#/.NET/React|Opportunity with company exponentially accelerating revenue and overall growth<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is an industry leader in the credit/debt information industry for loan officers, and this role is located in the heart of downtown Chicago. Since this is an urgent hire, they have a fairly "quick" interviewing process to fill this position.<strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Write correct and clean code; consistently upholds &amp; exemplifies stated best practices.</li><li>Participate actively in the design of new technical features.</li><li>Know when to ask for help in order to maximize workflow and if needed get unblocked.</li><li>Able to take ownership of small-to-medium features from technical design through completion.</li><li>Be capable of prioritizing tasks while avoiding getting caught up in insignificant details.</li><li>Ability to become self-sufficient in an area of the system with a high-level understanding of other components.</li><li>Capable of providing support for their system/platform area, including systems that they are not familiar with.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree or above in Computer Science or related field</li><li>At least 4-7 years of experience as a Software Developer / Engineer</li><li>Strong experience with Azure and C#/ .NET</li><li>Development experience Spring framework, Angular, React.</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Great opportunity for growth as this will be the first of internal engineer hires.</li><li>Competitve salary to be based on experience and interviews.</li><li>Excellent benefits package</li><li>Hybrid work structure (2-3 days/week in office)</li><li>Medical, dental, heathcare coverage</li><li>Generous PTO<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong>Please feel free to email your updated resume, a summary of your relevant experience, and 2 or more references to SeanStanton @ MichaelPage.US.com<br><br><strong>Contact: Sean Stanton<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6075647</strong>

title: EDI Developer
description: <p>[c. $100-200k Package, Flexible Working Options]</p><p><br></p><p>Join a titan of the trading industry as an Enterprise Site Reliability Engineer, where you'll redefine the game in their Enterprise Technology team. You'll bolster essential IT infrastructures and applications, striking the perfect harmony between user experience and system control. If you thrive on challenge and aspire to ensure systems run like clockwork, this might be your moment.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Role Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Develop cutting-edge solutions following robust engineering principles alongside an experienced team</li><li>Harness Python and PowerShell scripting to streamline build, configuration, deployment, and admin tasks</li><li>Bolster communication and collaboration, serving as a nexus between business users and tech teams</li><li>Deploy, oversee, and refine Windows infrastructure</li><li>Identify and actualise system enhancements for optimal performance</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Role Requirements:</strong></p><ul><li>Solid grasp of Microsoft infrastructure, including Windows Server, Desktop OS, Exchange, and SQL Server</li><li>Proficient scripting skills in PowerShell, Python, or comparable languages</li><li>Ability to dissect complex problems and make astute engineering decisions autonomously</li><li>Aptitude for thriving in a dynamic environment that values continuous improvement and feedback</li><li>An undergraduate degree in Computer Science or related engineering/science field</li></ul>

title: C# Developer - Chicago
description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?</strong><p><br></p><strong>Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter.</strong><p><br></p>As part of the Mondelēz International Business Services division, you have responsibility for a specific discipline that may include partnering with leaders in sales, finance, marketing, customer service and logistics, procurement, HR, etc. You lead a team that delivers best-in-class service and value creation to their clients and that strives for operational excellence at all times.<p><br></p><strong>How You Will Contribute</strong><p><br></p><strong><em>About the role </em></strong><p><br></p><strong><em><br><ul><li>This position will be hybrid (1-2 Days in the office per week)**<br><br></li></ul>Mondelēz Consumer Solutions Global MDS ( IT) Team is looking for people with strong technology skills to play important roles as part of technology and business transformations across:<br><br>As an Integration Engineer at Mondelez, you will be responsible for designing, building and implementing services on top of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and integrating them with the existing platforms &amp; SaaS capabilities leveraged across Consumer Engagement ecosystem. Such services will include Consumer Data related services including integration with Consumer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) systems, Privacy related Services &amp; Integrations, integrations with external SaaS capabilities. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to design and develop solutions that enable seamless data flow and application integration across various systems.<br><br><strong>What You Will Bring<br><br></strong>A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:<br><ul><li>Design and develop integrations between backend applications and GCP services using modern integration patterns and frameworks.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including application development, infrastructure, security, and operations teams, to ensure seamless integration and data flow across systems.</li><li>Design and implement integrations leveraging modern authentication and authorization protocols to be leveraged across multiple websites/applications.</li><li>Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements and design specifications.</li><li>Develop and maintain integration documentation, including technical design documents, deployment guides, and operational runbooks.</li><li>Conduct integration testing and resolve defects to ensure quality and reliability of the integrated systems.</li><li>Participate in agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, backlog grooming, and retrospectives.</li><li>Leading end-to-end process management for your specific discipline</li><li>Using shared services in a global environment</li><li>Leading teams, coaching, mentoring and experience managing performance driven by service level agreements and metrics</li><li>Customer service and managing relationships with demanding customers</li><li>Communicating effectively, organizational skills, problem solving and multi-tasking</li><li>Compliance and controls (experience in audits or part of programs where compliance is important)</li><li>Operating effectively in a changing environment and using initiative<br><br></li></ul><strong>More About This Role<br><br></strong><strong>What extra ingredients you will bring:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.</li><li>4-8 years of experience in designing and developing integrations between applications and systems.</li><li>Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, including Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Cloud Storage, and BigQuery.</li><li>Experience with integration frameworks and patterns, such as RESTful APIs, microservices, message queues, and event-driven architectures.</li><li>Experience with Consumer Identity and Access Management (CIAM) systems, authentication and authorization protocols</li><li>Strong programming skills in one or more of the following languages: .Net, Python, or Node.js.</li><li>Strong understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to debug complex integration issues.</li><li>Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.<br><br></li></ul>If you are passionate about designing and building innovative solutions that enable seamless data flow and application integration, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity at Mondelez.<br><br>No Relocation support available<br><br><strong>Business Unit Summary<br><br></strong>The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, we produce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including <em>Oreo</em> and <em>Chips Ahoy!</em> cookies, <em>Ritz</em>, <em>Wheat Thins</em> and <em>Triscuit</em> crackers, and <em>Swedish Fish</em> and <em>Sour Patch</em> <em>Kids</em> confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.<br><br>Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance.<br><br><strong>Job Type<br><br></strong>Regular<br><br>Experience Management<br><br>Global Business Services</em></strong>
industry: Food and Beverage Services, Food and Beverage Manufacturing, and Manufacturing

title: IT Integration Engineer
description: Duration: 2 months (with possible for extension)<br><br><strong><u>Description<br></u></strong><ul><li> One of our long-term Client is looking for a D365 developer for 6-8 weeks, with possible for extension. Task details as below:</li><li> Customize, configure, and test custom D365 Sales Module in UAT environment.</li><li> Develop custom forms, fields, and reports for leads and opportunities in D365 Sales.</li><li> Develop custom system views in leads and opportunities utilizing custom fields created.</li><li> Develop custom dashboards utilizing data to analyze success.</li><li> Apply business rules to fields to further automate process.</li><li> Import solution to Production environment.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Skillset And Certifications<br></u></strong><ul><li> 5 years of D365 Development experience.</li><li> MS Power Platform Development experience, PL-900 Certification preferred.</li><li> MS Sales, MB-210 Certification preferred.</li></ul>

title: AML Analyst - Entry Level
description: If you are a Linux Embedded Software Engineer with experience, please read on!<br><br>Salary: $110k-$140k+<br><br>Location: Hartford WI<br><br>WFH 2-3 times per week<br><br>What You Will Be Doing<br><br>Design, develop, and test firmware and applications on the company's hardware running Linux operating system.<br><ul><li> Designing and developing Linux BSP</li><li> Designing and developing Linux Applications</li><li> Provide customer technical support</li><li> Provide product support (Production, resolving bugs, etc.)<br></li></ul>What You Need for this Position<br><ul><li> 2+ Years of Linux Embedded Development Experience<br></li></ul><strong><u>You Should Know Some Of The Following<br></u></strong><ul><li> C/C++</li><li> Embedded Development</li><li> Scripting (Bash, Python, etc.)</li><li> Linux Kernal</li><li> Microprocessor peripheral driver development</li><li> working with hardware, schematics, and component data sheets</li><li> SVN</li><li> GIT</li><li> U-Boot or other standard boot loaders</li><li> GNU<br></li></ul>What's In It for You<br><ul><li> Great work environment</li><li> Amazing/Generous compensation package</li><li> Generous PTO</li><li> Full Benefits</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li>More!<br></li></ul>If you're interested, please provide the following to get the ball rolling:<br><ul><li> Updated resume</li><li> Salary requirements (a range would suffice)</li><li> Interview availability this week<br></li></ul>My email is Justin.Johnson@cybercoders.com.<br><br><strong><u>Email Your Resume In Word To<br><br></u></strong>Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:<br><br>Justin.Johnson@CyberCoders.com<br><ul><li>Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : JJ5-1739045L208 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***<br></li></ul>Justin Johnson - Lead Recruiter - CyberCoders<br><br>Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.<br><br><strong>CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer<br><br></strong>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br><strong>Your Right to Work</strong> – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.<br><br>

title: Software Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Perkins Coie, we look for self-motivated individuals, dedicated to providing value and superior service, and above all, have a high degree of integrity and enthusiasm for their work. We have created a company culture based on collaboration, devotion to serving our clients, and mutual respect. Perkins Coie is committed to advancing diversity and inclusion both within the firm and throughout our collective communities. Work with one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For and receive great health insurance, tuition reimbursement, and paid sabbaticals.<p><br></p><strong>GENERAL PURPOSE</strong><p><br></p>Perkins Coie LLP has an immediate opening for a Software Developer to serve as a member of the ServiceNow team. This role will work with IT service owners, process owners, and various service delivery groups to develop technical solutions that satisfy the business needs of Perkins Coie.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Functions</strong><p><br></p>The following essential functions are primary job duties that incumbents must be able to perform unassisted or with some reasonable accommodation.<p><br></p><ul><li>Development: Follow documented procedures to complete application or system-level changes and upgrades. Develop, configure, and customize ServiceNow applications and services. Ensure tool configuration consistency across development and production environments. Support the entire development lifecycle and integrate ServiceNow applications with other programs. </li><li>Test &amp; Deployment: Follow and perform tests to ensure appropriate implementation of new changes and upgrades. Perform code reviews to ensure that the quality bar is being met regarding coding standards, integration, extensibility, and security. Create and review test plans to assure business workflow and reporting meet requirements when implemented.</li><li>End User Support: Assists the platform administrator with incident resolution. Manage and escalate issues to the service management vendor when appropriate. Troubleshoot bugs, fix defects and support users of applications developed by the enterprise application development team. Build and maintain effective working relationships with users and peers and work effectively in a team environment.</li><li>Professional Development: Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading articles and publications, and attending user groups.</li><li>Perform other duties, as assigned. </li><li>Be present at work during regularly scheduled working hours and as needed in the position, consistent with the firm’s attendance expectations.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Specific Skills Required</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>To comply with Export Control laws, candidates must be a U.S. Citizen or lawful permanent resident to apply</li><li>Working knowledge of the ServiceNow modules including IT Service Management (ITSM) of incidents, requests, changes, problems, and CSM</li><li>Working knowledge of networking in a Microsoft Windows environment including client/server and web technologies</li><li>Working knowledge of Web Technologies (XML, HTML, JavaScript, Web Services, etc.) and of working in a SaaS environment</li><li>Experience in developing integrations between ServiceNow and other systems via APIs</li><li>Strong oral and written communication skills</li><li>Ability to exercise good judgment in prioritizing multiple tasks and addressing problems while under time and resource constraints</li><li>Being a self-starter with strong time management skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to quality</li><li>Experience with ITSM dashboard design</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Specific Skills Preferred</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>General understanding of the applications and business workflows of law firms</li><li>Working knowledge of IT asset management (SAM and Hardware), configuration management database (CMDB), and IT operations management modules</li><li>Understanding of ITSM lifecycle workflows and Service Management Integration</li><li>Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum)</li><li>Experience writing PowerShell scripts</li><li>Experience with data analysis and reporting</li><li>Experience with the ITIL Framework</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education And Experience</strong><p><br></p>2-3 years of related Applications Support/Administration or Analysis experience. 3-5 years’ experience developing in ServiceNow. Bachelor’s degree in engineering or computer science is beneficial.<p><br></p><em>This position is eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, 401(k) plan, medical, dental, and vision insurance, accrued paid time off plan starting at 20 days annually, personal medical and parental leave, up to ten paid Holidays, and family care benefits. More information regarding benefits and programs may be found</em><em> here</em><em>.</em><p><br></p><em>This position may be filled in the following location(s). The compensation depends on qualifications and experience.</em><p><br></p><em>Colorado compensation range: $100,140 to $157,650 annually</em><p><br></p><em>Washington State compensation range: $105,630 to $166,300 annually</em><p><br></p>#TechDept<p><br></p>

title: Software Developer
description: 77 West Wacker Dr (35012), United States of America, Chicago, Illinois<p><br></p>SailPoint Engineer (Remote-Eligible)<p><br></p>Do you want to work for a tech company that writes its own code, develops its own software, and builds its own products? We experiment and innovate leveraging the latest technologies, engineer breakthrough customer experiences, and bring simplicity and humanity to banking. We make a difference for 65 million customers.<p><br></p>At Capital One, you’ll be part of a big group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We want you to be curious and ask “what if?” Capital One started as an information strategy company that specialized in credit cards, and we have become one of the most impactful and disruptive players in the industry. We have grown to see ourselves as a technology company in consumer finance, with great opportunities for engineers who want to build innovative applications to give users smarter ways to save, transact, borrow and invest their money, as we seek to disrupt the industry again.<p><br></p><strong>As a Capital One SailPoint Engineer, you’ll work on a SailPoint identity platform to support Identity Access Management needs.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead Identity and access management (IAM) Certification team and define Certification strategy for the Enterprise. </li><li>Lead large Enterprise wide Certification campaigns, Perform User access certification activations and validations.</li><li>Identify opportunities for automation, evaluate new tools, and drive implementation of technology that creates value for the organization.</li><li>Build strong relationships with customers, stakeholders, and team members</li><li>Provide regular updates to the management team on project progress</li><li>Rally Team to deliver successful results on critical Projects and Incidents Excellent organizational and Communication Skills Ability to pick up new technologies quickly Pro-active, flexible and a high competency with people.</li><li>Producing Certification reports for leadership</li><li>Plan and execute the POC for upcoming requirements and work with developers to implement the solution</li><li>Identifying business requirements and translating them into technical requirements for development teams</li><li>Improve the performance of current reports by rewriting SQL queries</li><li>Documenting and improving the operational standard operating procedures</li><li>Assist end users in completing access certifications and support day-to-day operations</li><li>Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve SailPoint-related functional and technical issues</li><li>Assist in monitoring, troubleshooting, and providing problem resolutions to related incidents</li><li>Operational support with change and incident management processes</li><li>Identify opportunities for automation, evaluate new tools, and drive implementation of technology that creates value for the organization</li><li>Develop automated solutions using scripts and cloud-based server-less computing platforms</li><li>Build operational reports and support ad hoc data requests<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Basic Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High school diploma, GED or equivalent certification</li><li>At least 2 years of experience in Information Security</li><li>At least 1 year of experience supporting SailPoint Applications<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree </li><li>3+ years of experience supporting Java and SailPoint applications</li><li>3+ years of experience troubleshooting SailPoint workflows and customizations</li><li>3+ years of experience with Role Based Access Controls (RBAC)</li><li>3+ years of experience troubleshooting end user issues in Access Certifications</li><li>2+ years of experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)</li><li>ITIL Certification </li><li>AWS Certification <br></li></ul><p><br></p><em>At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.</em><p><br></p>The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below, by location.
