description_json: 77 West Wacker Dr (35012), United States of America, Chicago, Illinois<p><br></p>SailPoint Engineer (Remote-Eligible)<p><br></p>Do you want to work for a tech company that writes its own code, develops its own software, and builds its own products? We experiment and innovate leveraging the latest technologies, engineer breakthrough customer experiences, and bring simplicity and humanity to banking. We make a difference for 65 million customers.<p><br></p>At Capital One, you’ll be part of a big group of makers, breakers, doers and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We want you to be curious and ask “what if?” Capital One started as an information strategy company that specialized in credit cards, and we have become one of the most impactful and disruptive players in the industry. We have grown to see ourselves as a technology company in consumer finance, with great opportunities for engineers who want to build innovative applications to give users smarter ways to save, transact, borrow and invest their money, as we seek to disrupt the industry again.<p><br></p><strong>As a Capital One SailPoint Engineer, you’ll work on a SailPoint identity platform to support Identity Access Management needs.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead Identity and access management (IAM) Certification team and define Certification strategy for the Enterprise. </li><li>Lead large Enterprise wide Certification campaigns, Perform User access certification activations and validations.</li><li>Identify opportunities for automation, evaluate new tools, and drive implementation of technology that creates value for the organization.</li><li>Build strong relationships with customers, stakeholders, and team members</li><li>Provide regular updates to the management team on project progress</li><li>Rally Team to deliver successful results on critical Projects and Incidents Excellent organizational and Communication Skills Ability to pick up new technologies quickly Pro-active, flexible and a high competency with people.</li><li>Producing Certification reports for leadership</li><li>Plan and execute the POC for upcoming requirements and work with developers to implement the solution</li><li>Identifying business requirements and translating them into technical requirements for development teams</li><li>Improve the performance of current reports by rewriting SQL queries</li><li>Documenting and improving the operational standard operating procedures</li><li>Assist end users in completing access certifications and support day-to-day operations</li><li>Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve SailPoint-related functional and technical issues</li><li>Assist in monitoring, troubleshooting, and providing problem resolutions to related incidents</li><li>Operational support with change and incident management processes</li><li>Identify opportunities for automation, evaluate new tools, and drive implementation of technology that creates value for the organization</li><li>Develop automated solutions using scripts and cloud-based server-less computing platforms</li><li>Build operational reports and support ad hoc data requests<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Capital One is open to hiring a Remote Employee for this opportunity.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Basic Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>High school diploma, GED or equivalent certification</li><li>At least 2 years of experience in Information Security</li><li>At least 1 year of experience supporting SailPoint Applications<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree </li><li>3+ years of experience supporting Java and SailPoint applications</li><li>3+ years of experience troubleshooting SailPoint workflows and customizations</li><li>3+ years of experience with Role Based Access Controls (RBAC)</li><li>3+ years of experience troubleshooting end user issues in Access Certifications</li><li>2+ years of experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS)</li><li>ITIL Certification </li><li>AWS Certification description: <strong>Software Engineer/Onsite Coordinator Wheeling, IL <br><br></strong>Onsite client location Monday through Friday<br><br>Consultant with enhanced benefits<br><br><strong><u>Top Skills' Details<br></u></strong><ul><li>C#</li><li>Net</li><li>Embedded Systems</li><li>Linux<br></li></ul><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Design and develop C#.Net based embedded software through the full SDLC<br><br>Implement applications that run on the Linux OS<br><br>Write software design specifications<br><br>Participate in peer source code and design reviews<br><br>Mentor junior level engineers<br><br>This role will serve as an escalation point for technical and customer issues that may arise<br><br>Collaborate with the Project Manager on the quality and timeliness of the deliverable to ensure compliance to Quality Management System processes.<br><br>Note: this role will not have any direct employee reports and is approximately 75% hands on, performing software design, development, and testing.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications<br><br></strong>BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science and at least 5 years of experience as a Software Engineer/Developer<br><br>Experience leading engineers including training, mentorship, clarification of requirements and architecture<br><br>Experience planning and delegating tasks based on evaluation of capability with a project team<br><br>Experience with the full SDLC using the C# programming language, OOP architecture, and .Net framework<br><br>Ability to read Java code<br><br>Experience with <strong>Linux based embedded software<br><br></strong>Ability to create supporting documentation such as design documents, architecture diagrams, test procedures and reports.<br><br>Good oral and written communication skills with the ability to professionally support periodic communication to management and technical teams<br><br>Experience with Agile Scrum development methodologies and common workflow tools: GIT, Jira, etc<br><br><strong><u>Desired Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Understanding of REST APIs<br><br>Experience designing software for a distributed network for <strong>CAN or Ethernet communication<br><br></strong>Experience designing software for display systems and closed loop control systems<br><br>Experience with common debugging tools such as oscilloscopes, network analyzer, emulators

title: GCP Integration Services Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>As an Architect: Salesforce Integration - supporting Bond and Specialty Insurance, you will collaborate with senior Technology and Business leaders and apply your knowledge of modern technology to influence and innovate solutions that impact the business. In this role we will look to you to:<br><ul><li>Architect integrations to/from existing systems with Salesforce via APIs &amp; Events </li><li>Provide architecture “runway” for engineering teams by running POC/POTs </li><li>Partner with value stream/engineering team to accelerate their learning and delivery in the cloud </li><li>To provide enhancement to current process <br><br></li></ul><strong>What Will You Do? <br></strong><ul><li>Architecture responsibility within a major segment of Technology Architecture in support of the Bond and Specialty Insurance business unit </li><li>Leads technology proof of concepts to ensure feasibility of architecture solutions </li><li>Hands-on prototyping of new technology solutions </li><li>Partner with Software Engineering to execute proof of technologies </li><li>Provides architecture direction for engineers in support of a technical pattern </li><li>Displays strong thought leadership in pursuit of modern architecture principals and technology modernization </li><li>Drives continuous technology transformation to minimize technical debt </li><li>Create a partnership with Software Engineering </li><li>Looks for opportunities to capitalize on technology advances through analysis of key industry and technology trends to assess potential impact on the enterprise </li><li>Participates in defining target state technology architecture and roadmaps </li><li>Ensures alignment of IT initiatives with the target state </li><li>Builds strong partnership with engineering to ensure proper alignment of skills with technology direction </li><li>Continuously improve efficiency and effectiveness of the architecture </li><li>Perform other duties as assigned. <br><br></li></ul><strong>What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have? <br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s in technology related field or equivalent with 10+ years of technology Engineering experience </li><li>Hands-on knowledge of Salesforce integration </li><li>Practical experience using system integration tools (AWS, Mulesoft, Kafka and/or equivalents) </li><li>Organizational experience in an agile operating model </li><li>Established work in proof of concepts and technology </li><li>Strong proven Software Engineering experience </li><li>Supports technology target state, roadmaps that aligned to Short- and Long-term business goals </li><li>Insurance technology experience desired </li><li>Strong grasp of value creation and business capability models </li><li>Innovation and Continuous Improvement </li><li>Must be passionate about technology transformations </li><li>Has hands on experience in the last 3 years </li><li>Executed technology modernization initiatives including migration to cloud native and API Strategy </li><li>Current experience with Cloud, APIs, accelerators, DevSecOps </li><li>Strong architecture experience on Cloud </li><li>Good understanding of security </li><li>Experienced with large scale technology platforms <br><br></li></ul><strong>What is a Must Have? <br><br></strong>Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent in work experience.<br><br>Five years of experience in engineering software or analytic applications within a line of business area

title: Embedded Software Engineer (HYBRID - WFH)
description: <ul><li>LOOKING FOR A NEW LABVIEW OPPORTUNITY?</li><li>I have the one for YOU! My client manufactures Electronics and Telematics for the Automotive/Transportation industry. They are looking for a Tenured Test Engineer to help test the Electronics during and post manufacturing. You will be apart of the team that develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that is built to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws, focusing on manufacturing defects. You will be building a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products. You will be working with the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements and then write the software to implement. title: Project Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: EST | Full day overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $105</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Short term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>You have proven engineering and coding skills, data structure knowledge and ability to write high performance production quality code.</li><li>You have experience in building developer tools/platforms and/or backend systems.</li><li>You can learn complex (and imperfect) systems quickly and devise simple and effective solutions to high-priority problems</li><li>You are an effective communicator in both written and verbal forms, within the team and with customers.<br><br></li></ul><strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Our client is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. They build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect millions of entrepreneurs with millions of buyers around the world. As an employee whether a team member of the company, you will tackle unique, meaningful, and large-scale problems alongside passionate coworkers, all the while making a rewarding impact and Keeping Commerce Human.<br><br>The team builds offline testing tools for numerous product and infrastructure teams working on information retrieval (IR). Their tools enable those teams to assess the quality and performance of IR services during development, empowering them to effectively and efficiently deliver the best that the company has to offer at scale.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br></strong><ul><li>Design, build and support the offline testing system for information retrieval apps.</li><li>Work with other engineers on the team to design and drive the delivery of new features.</li><li>Practice continuous learning and agile delivery to stay informed and focused on our client's deliverables.</li><li>Work cross-functionally with various platform teams, ML teams and product partners to enable them in delivering features.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6749<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: ServiceNow Developer
description: <strong>Title:</strong> C Programming Developer<p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago IL</strong><p><br></p><strong>Hire Type:</strong> CONTRACT<p><br></p><strong>Overview:</strong><p><br></p>Sterling has helped build careers for thousands of professionals like yourself. Our expert recruiters support you at every step in the process and as a Best of Staffing company, Sterling provides exciting work with exceptional employers across the U.S.<p><br></p>As a contract employee of Sterling, you are eligible to receive a <strong>Full Em</strong><strong>ployee Benefits Package </strong>that includes <strong>paid time off, paid holidays, 3 medical plans to choose from, dental &amp; vision plans, 401(k), and an Employee Stock Ownership (ESOP) plan.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary: </strong><p><br></p>The software developer's role will be to review existing C code and document application logic including customizations done by requesting applications. This will also include reviewing findings with senior-level developers to ensure accuracy.<p><br></p><strong>Job Duties:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Review and document existing code.</li><li> Thoroughly test applications to validate documented functionality.</li><li> Work with business analysts to create final document.</li><li> The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all encompassing.</li><li> Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5-10 years experience working as an application designer and software developer working with enterprise applications.</li><li> Technically fluent in programming languages, primarily C.</li><li> Knowledge of database design and file management techniques.</li><li> Hands-on software troubleshooting experience.</li><li> Experience with specific phases of the software development life cycle including requirements gathering, requirements analysis, design, development, and test.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</em></strong>

description: <strong>Job#: 1330430<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description:<br><br></strong><u><strong>API Developer <br><br></strong></u><strong>Job Description: <br></strong><ul><li>This position is on the API Management team within Digital. The team is responsible for the process, controls, and tools that support API development, security, publishing, consumption, and monitoring.</li><li>Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work.</li><li>Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls.</li><li>Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems.</li><li>Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features</li><li>Maintains high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits 6. Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team</li><li>Guide the team to develop a structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation, and user guides in a casual, flexible environment.</li><li>Communicate with end-users and internal customers to help direct the development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness.</li><li>Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Typical Day</strong>:<br><ul><li>Work within API Management team, hands-on APIGEE Edge, OAS Spec review, Proxy development. Hybrid work, need to be at located at commutable distance from Chicago. There will be an in person interview.</li><li>Will be working with team members across the world virtually. Will also be interacting with team members in the Chicago office twice a week.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education/Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Position requires a four-year degree from an accredited college or university. 2. 2+ years or more of software development experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Technical Skills Required</strong>:<br><br>(Required)<br><ul><li>Experience writing API proxies on platforms such as Apigee Edge, AWS API Gateway or Azure API Gateway or similar.</li><li>Hands on experience with API tools such as Swagger Editor &amp; Postman, and linting tools like Spectral.</li><li>Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth 2.0 and TLS.<br><br></li></ul>(Desired)<br><ul><li>Familiarity working in a Scrum environment</li><li>Must demonstrate solid knowledge of computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms.</li><li>Hands on experience with metrics and visualization tools like Kibana, Grafana, or equivalent.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Soft Skills Required:<br></strong><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal skills</li><li>Ability to work under pressure and within time constraints.</li><li>Passion for technology and an eagerness to contribute to a team-oriented environment.</li><li>Must be reliable and proactive – able to work independently and meet deadlines.<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. title: Salesforce Architect
description: <strong>Job Title: Software Engineer - Frontend</strong> <strong>Exp: 8+ Yrs</strong> <strong>Number of Positions : 1</strong> <strong>Work location: Evanston, IL(On-site)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Direct hire by Client!!</strong> <strong>Type of Position : Full-Time</strong><p><br></p>Client is seeking a talented and experienced Software Engineer for frontend development to join our team. As a frontend developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our web-based SaaS platform, ensuring they are visually appealing, user-friendly, and highly functional. You will collaborate with our cross-functional teams, including backend developers and scientific software developers, to deliver exceptional user experiences and drive innovation.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).<p><br></p>Proven experience as a frontend developer or similar role, with a strong portfolio of web development projects.<p><br></p>Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript, and related frontend frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).<p><br></p>Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and frontend build tools (e.g., Vite).<p><br></p>Knowledge of web accessibility standards and best practices.<p><br></p>Familiarity with backend technologies and APIs.<p><br></p>Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.<p><br></p>Strong communication and collaboration abilities.<p><br></p><strong>Interested candidates can share the resumes to or reach me @</strong>

title: APIGEE Developer
description: <strong>Sr. Software Engineer<br><br></strong><strong>Pay: </strong>$70 - $75 w2<br><br><strong>Contract Length:</strong> 6 months contract (potential extension)<br><br><strong>Location: Chicago, IL </strong>(hybrid)<br><br><strong><u>Notes<br><br></u></strong>Candidate will be expected to contribute immediately building applications in React and Node JS. For visual problems, a combination of JavaScript and CSS, for backend services, mostly Node JS and some Java.<br><br>Client is seeking Senior Software Engineers to assist with our product development initiatives, as well as help drive new groundbreaking applications designed for client associates and guests. This is a position that is ideal for someone who is skilled and passionate about front-end and/or back-end development, who is eager to fill in the gaps in their toolbox.<br><ul><li>The team is responsible for architecture, methodology, tools and processes, and delivery management for the development and support of client website, mobile apps, and new apps created in an internal startup environment.</li><li>As a member of this team, Software Engineers provide input as we partner with all business functions to help build a digital culture.</li><li>Our team works closely with Product Development to plan and negotiate iterative development cycles in an agile environment.</li><li>They also collaborate with the Operations team to build infrastructure and care for company website and associated properties in production, as Tier 3 support.</li><li>They apply DevOps tools and culture to deliver software to production early and often, with highly automated and reliable procedures.</li><li>A partial, unordered list of desired skills includes Java, Ruby on Rails, Adobe CQ5 and DAM, JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, Jenkins, Cloud Foundry, OpenStack, and Selenium. Primary Responsibilities: Analyze requirements, Develop front-end software.</li><li>Develop back-end software. Develop automated tests. Develop automated deployment process.</li><li>Provide Tier 3 production support.</li><li>Participate in architecture reviews and technology standards definition.</li><li>The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all encompassing.</li><li>Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications -<br></u></strong><ul><li>You like Agile. You like DevOps. Thus you like Continuous Delivery. You like Clouds, with everything-aaS.</li><li>You like to build upon platforms composed of loosely coupled, contractually obligated services.</li><li>Terms like API Façade make you smile.</li><li>You love open source and are willing to contribute back to the communities.</li><li>You want to help software take over the world, and help provide Authentic Hospitality in the process. You want mobile apps to be first class citizens in the software world with capabilities equal to or better than webapps.<br></li></ul><strong><u>On Being a Senior Engineer<br></u></strong><ul><li>This is a senior level position that is ideal for someone skilled, passionate about development, and eager to expand their influence in surrounding areas.</li><li>This is an opportunity to practice mentorship skills with more-junior developers, often receiving guidance from more experienced mentors.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Desired Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>4+ years of experience in a full-time development role.</li><li>Previous experience as a tech lead or team lead, mentoring junior developers.</li><li>B.S. preferred, in Computer Science or related discipline. Software Engineering, Architecture, Technical Operations.</li><li>Strong Agile experience preferred.</li><li>Preferred candidate is passionate about travel and the Hospitality industry<br></li></ul>#PCIT<br><br>

title: Functional PeopleSoft Business Analyst/Developer
description: <strong>Your opportunity<br></strong>New Relic is looking for someone to contribute to our open-source .NET agent software! At New Relic, we help people build better software. Our product, The .NET Agent, observes interactions between applications and the .NET frameworks and makes the interactions visible to our customers to improve their performance and reliability.<br><br>You will be at the heart of New Relic’s best-in-class APM solution, with a focus on our open source .NET agent. Engaging the community to influence the direction and drive innovation, your contributions to our lightweight and dependable data collection software [https://github.com/newrelic/newrelic-dotnet-agent] will directly impact our mission.<br><br>We are excited to consider a remote engineer for this role in the Pacific Standard Time zone. If you are not in the PST zone, we’ll work out a time window that overlaps most of the team’s office hours.<br><br><strong>What you'll do<br></strong><ul><li>Deliver high-quality, performant software with an emphasis on scalability and reliability.</li><li>Learn and grow your skills as a software developer.</li><li>Meet the evolving needs of our software</li><li>Ensure that our software implementation fits with our architectural vision.</li><li>Collaborate with your team, external contributors, and others to help solve problems.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Team Traits:<br></strong><ul><li>We are curious! We seek beyond the surface of the technologies we use and need to understand the internals.</li><li>We deliver value incrementally. We get satisfaction by building tools that help developers get stuff done.</li><li>Accountability: We never say something is “not our problem”. If it’s our customer’s problem, it is our problem, too. We never drop the ball.</li><li>Teamwork: </li><li>We work closely together and believe in the power of pairing. We understand there is a balance between individual heads down and pairing. </li><li>Our “first job” is the job we were hired for (all of the above). Our “second job” is to help others around us to succeed at their jobs. Balancing first and second jobs makes us better, more effective, and happier. We share what we know. </li><li>Being an autonomous team in a larger organization, with all teams working well together, requires strong communication. We write proposals, specs, and retrospectives. We give talks, and we demo the work we are doing.</li><li>.NET expertise: We write instrumentation to help our customers observe their complex systems. We are sensitive to the usage of resources and the performance of our codebase. description_json: <strong>Your opportunity<br></strong>New Relic is looking for someone to contribute to our open-source .NET agent software! At New Relic, we help people build better software. Our product, The .NET Agent, observes interactions between applications and the .NET frameworks and makes the interactions visible to our customers to improve their performance and reliability.<br><br>You will be at the heart of New Relic’s best-in-class APM solution, with a focus on our open source .NET agent. Engaging the community to influence the direction and drive innovation, your contributions to our lightweight and dependable data collection software [https://github.com/newrelic/newrelic-dotnet-agent] will directly impact our mission.<br><br>We are excited to consider a remote engineer for this role in the Pacific Standard Time zone. If you are not in the PST zone, we’ll work out a time window that overlaps most of the team’s office hours.<br><br><strong>What you'll do<br></strong><ul><li>Deliver high-quality, performant software with an emphasis on scalability and reliability.</li><li>Learn and grow your skills as a software developer.</li><li>Meet the evolving needs of our software</li><li>Ensure that our software implementation fits with our architectural vision.</li><li>Collaborate with your team, external contributors, and others to help solve problems.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Team Traits:<br></strong><ul><li>We are curious! We seek beyond the surface of the technologies we use and need to understand the internals.</li><li>We deliver value incrementally. We get satisfaction by building tools that help developers get stuff done.</li><li>Accountability: We never say something is “not our problem”. If it’s our customer’s problem, it is our problem, too. We never drop the ball.</li><li>Teamwork: </li><li>We work closely together and believe in the power of pairing. We understand there is a balance between individual heads down and pairing. </li><li>Our “first job” is the job we were hired for (all of the above). Our “second job” is to help others around us to succeed at their jobs. Balancing first and second jobs makes us better, more effective, and happier. We share what we know. </li><li>Being an autonomous team in a larger organization, with all teams working well together, requires strong communication. We write proposals, specs, and retrospectives. description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire/ FTE Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (Time Zone: EST, PST/CIST, CST | Partial overlap)</li><li>SALARY RANGE: $45,000 – $65,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with developing interactive, customer facing applications and websites; </li><li>Software development foundations: solid software design patterns and scalable web service APIs principles; </li><li>Experience with test-driven development; </li><li>Proficiency in software engineering tools; and </li><li>Ability to document requirements and specifications </li><li>BSc degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant field; </li><li>3-5 years’ experience in a similar position; </li><li>Required Technical skills: React, Vue, PHP, REST, JavaScript/Ajax/jQuery, MySQL, AWS, nginx, Apache Tomcat, Docker, Linux </li><li>Additional skills: WordPress, Python, shell scripting, git, Jenkins, Bamboo, Docker, AWS </li><li>DevOps certification is a big plus, </li><li>Previous Financial industry experience a plus. </li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>You will be responsible for overseeing the maintenance and development of applications within the FE international and LTV Fund portfolio </li><li>The role main business function is to support FE International and LTV Fund mission to build out high-quality, innovative and fully performing scalable software, complying with the highest coding standards </li><li>Design and execute full software development life cycle; </li><li>Write well-designed and testable code; </li><li>Work with a third party team of developers; </li><li>Produce specifications and determine operational feasibility; </li><li>Integrate software components into a fully functional software system; </li><li>Develop software verification plans and quality assurance procedures; </li><li>Document and maintain software functionality; </li><li>Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade existing systems; </li><li>Deploy programs and evaluate user feedback; </li><li>Comply with project plans and industry standards; </li><li>Ensure software is updated with latest features; and </li><li>Other ad-hoc software duties as required by the business. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6653<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer
description: At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us. The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees' personal and professional lives. Position Summary: The Data Science team at Horizon Therapeutics is looking for an extraordinary Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting data science solutions that drive impact for patients. In this role you will be leveraging cutting edge artificial intelligence, algorithms, and technology to influence decisions across the organization. The role requires extensive knowledge of machine learning, the creativity to correctly identify opportunities for data science to be impactful, and a passion for the life sciences. You will assist matrixed teams across multiple therapeutic areas and commercial functions. This individual should be an expert at manipulating messy data and apply object-oriented design principles to automate outputs and datasets. The Data Scientist should be experienced in moving models from development to production, and have a good sense for tracking and updating model performance. Some key projects that the Data Scientist will support include physician targeting and segmentation, lead generation for our field sales teams, patient journey mapping and prediction, disease incidence and prevalence projection, and predicting patients likely to start therapy. Qualifications and Skills Required: BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning &amp; Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, or a related technical discipline Masters degree in a relevant technical field or 1 year of relevant data science experience Strong working knowledge of state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and a solid grounding in traditional algorithms like linear regression, tree models, probabilistic (Bayesian) approaches, and clustering Ability to juggle multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment Expert proficiency with Python and SQL Experience with Pyspark, and familiarity working in a cloud-based technology stack Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with Healthcare Datasets such as APLD claims and/or EMR/EHR records, as well as their respective nuances Experience in the commercial pharmaceutical space Experience working on data science projects in a production environment Our Values Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference. Accountability: We do what's right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures. Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients. These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one's team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better. Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Qualifications and Skills Required: BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning &amp; Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, or a related technical discipline Masters degree in a relevant technical field or 1 year of relevant data science experience Strong working knowledge of state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and a solid grounding in traditional algorithms like linear regression, tree models, probabilistic (Bayesian) approaches, and clustering Ability to juggle multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment Expert proficiency with Python and SQL Experience with Pyspark, and familiarity working in a cloud-based technology stack Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with Healthcare Datasets such as APLD claims and/or EMR/EHR records, as well as their respective nuances Experience in the commercial pharmaceutical space Experience working on data science projects in a production environment Our Values Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference. Accountability: We do what's right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures. Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients. These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one's team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better. Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.
description_json: At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us. The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees' personal and professional lives. Position Summary: The Data Science team at Horizon Therapeutics is looking for an extraordinary Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting data science solutions that drive impact for patients. In this role you will be leveraging cutting edge artificial intelligence, algorithms, and technology to influence decisions across the organization. The role requires extensive knowledge of machine learning, the creativity to correctly identify opportunities for data science to be impactful, and a passion for the life sciences. You will assist matrixed teams across multiple therapeutic areas and commercial functions. This individual should be an expert at manipulating messy data and apply object-oriented design principles to automate outputs and datasets. The Data Scientist should be experienced in moving models from development to production, and have a good sense for tracking and updating model performance. Some key projects that the Data Scientist will support include physician targeting and segmentation, lead generation for our field sales teams, patient journey mapping and prediction, disease incidence and prevalence projection, and predicting patients likely to start therapy. Qualifications and Skills Required: BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning &amp; Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, or a related technical discipline Masters degree in a relevant technical field or 1 year of relevant data science experience Strong working knowledge of state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and a solid grounding in traditional algorithms like linear regression, tree models, probabilistic (Bayesian) approaches, and clustering Ability to juggle multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment Expert proficiency with Python and SQL Experience with Pyspark, and familiarity working in a cloud-based technology stack Preferred Qualifications: Familiarity with Healthcare Datasets such as APLD claims and/or EMR/EHR records, as well as their respective nuances Experience in the commercial pharmaceutical space Experience working on data science projects in a production environment Our Values Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference. Accountability: We do what's right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures. title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer
description: <ul><li>READY TO DO YOUR PART AND HELP PROTECT OUR TROOPS?* I have the position for you! My client is currently hiring for an Embedded Software Engineer to develop products to help protect our troops. In this position you will be working with Embedded C/C++ within VxWorks operating systems for software development. This position requires you to be doing both Embedded C development along with C++ Object Oriented Programming with some being OOD development, design patterns, and deeper OO concepts. This also includes Embedded Software Development and doing application level while working with many different communication protocols and working with RF Electronic Warfare Systems as part of a large team and program.</li><li>Skills:*</li><li>VxWorks</li><li>Clearance</li><li>C/C++</li><li>Embedded C</li><li>Linux</li><li>RTOS</li><li>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:*</li><li>Must have an active secret clearance as they are putting them on programs asap for cleared work</li><li>Must have experience in real-time system</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Experience Level:* 3+ years of experience working with C/C++<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: R Developer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As a <strong>Senior Associate Application Engineer (Full Stack),</strong> you<strong>’</strong>ll build and release reliable software systems at scale. By partnering with enterprise-wide) teams, you’ll develop and maintain full stack solutions that fit our business needs. You’ll use your holistic view of all products (and their interactions) to design elegant solutions and strategize the future state of our larger technical ecosystem. By independently innovating and advocating for best practices, you’ll solve complex problems and guide the team on implementing solutions from inception to production.<p><br></p>In this specific role, you will be part of a product team responsible for the technical development in the Bank Collections department. Each product team is responsible for new business features as well as a strong focus on application modernization and building out the CI/CD pipeline for the Discover bank collections platform (E-ICE).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Completes most features and user stories including test cases and automation unattended</li><li>Learns more complex software engineering practices such as domain driven design, test driven development, operations, and security</li><li>Contributes to agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms, and participates in technology communities</li><li>Participates in system design decisions and learns how these decisions impact the product as a whole</li><li>Learns to support production systems and understands how observed events and failures impact the product</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related</li><li>1+ Years – Information Technology, (Software) Engineering, or related</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of advanced beginner on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><ul><li>Either hands on experience or ability to quickly learn and adapt to our tech stack</li><ul><li>Java/JavaScript programming</li><li>Eclipse RCP or Java Swing</li><li>Cloud Technology – AWS, Pivotal Cloud Foundry, OpenShift</li><li>Extreme automation mindset as it pertains to testing and build/deploy concepts</li><li>CI/CD Pipeline experience via Jenkins, Github Actions, Chef, Ansible, Nexus</li></ul><li>Knowledge of the banking industry a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $70,000.00 to $118,400.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer
description: Take your career to the next level as an embedded software engineer, using your expertise in embedded C and MATLAB/Simulink to develop advanced features for the off-highway autonomous vehicle industry and push the technology of flagship vehicles such as tractors, harvesters, combines, and excavators to the next level.<br><ul><li>Your Responsibilities:*</li><li>Design, develop, and test software for enterprise programming and infrastructure solutions</li><li>Operate in a scrum team environment on varying project scope and direction from a project lead</li><li>Support the team with concept, development and testing of solutions</li><li>Software:*</li><li>Embedded C/C++</li><li>MATLAB/Simulink</li><li>Qualifications:*</li><li>Demonstrated capability in software product development using C++, C, Python and scripting languages</li><li>Training or experience with Object-Oriented Analysis/Design (OOA/D) and multi-threaded systems</li><li>Experience that demonstrates you are a self-starter, and able to work well without close direction</li><li>Demonstrated capability performing in an engineering team environment and interfacing with engineers and personnel of other disciplines</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of software industry experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Break down requirements into Epics, Features and User stories.</strong></li><li>Requirement documentation and tracking</li><li>Get User sign off in timely fashion for the Business requirements.</li><li>Support system integration and user Acceptance testing(UAT). Assist Business users in functionality/features testing in SIT and UAT testing.</li><li>Onsite and offshore co-ordination.</li><li>Develop and maintain an understanding of the user business operating environment,</li><li>Coordinate and respond to original specifications change requests.</li><li><br></li></ul><p><br></p><p><u>Work Location – Use as appropriate:</u></p><p>· Work Location: Chicago, IL </p><p><br></p><p><u>Job Type:</u></p><p>· Full-time (With Medical, Dental, Vision (MDV for Self &amp; Family), PTO, Holidays, Insurance, 401K</p><p><br></p><p><u>About US:</u></p><p>LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen &amp; Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.</p><p><br></p><p><u>Equal Employment Opportunity Policy:</u></p><p>LTIMindtree provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics.</p><p><br></p><p><u>Safe return to office</u>:</p><p>In order to comply with LTIMindtree’s company COVID-19 vaccine mandate, candidates must be able to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19 before or by the date of hire. Alternatively, one may submit a request for reasonable accommodation from LTIMindtree’s COVID-19 vaccination mandate for approval, in accordance with applicable state and federal law, by the date of hire. Any request is subject to review through LTIMindtree’s applicable processes.</p>

title: Java Engineer
description: <ul><li>Onsite client location Monday through Friday</li><li> Consultant with enhanced benefits</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design and develop C# .NET based embedded software through the full SDLC</li><li> Implement applications that run on the Linux OS</li><li> Write software design specifications</li><li> Participate in peer source code and design reviews</li><li> Mentor junior level engineers</li><li> Assume an Onsite Coordinator role within the project by facilitating communication between Client and Actalent Offshore Team, coordinate with Client stakeholders to understand requirements and architecture, and clarifying validation failures to Actalent Offshore Team</li><li> This role will serve as an escalation point for technical and customer issues that may arise</li><li> Collaborate with the Project Manager on the quality and timeliness of the deliverable to ensure compliance to Quality Management System processes.</li><li> Note: this role will not have any direct employee reports and is approximately 75% hands on, performing software design, development, and testing.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>C#, .NET, embedded system, Linux, java<p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science and at least 5 years of experience as a Software Engineer/Developer</li><li> Experience leading engineers including training, mentorship, clarification of requirements and architecture</li><li> Experience planning and delegating tasks based on evaluation of capability with a project team</li><li> Experience with the full SDLC using the C# programming language, OOP architecture, and .NET framework</li><li> Ability to read Java code</li><li> Experience with Linux based embedded software</li><li> Ability to create supporting documentation such as design documents, architecture diagrams, test procedures and reports.</li><li> Good oral and written communication skills with the ability to professionally support periodic communication to management and technical teams</li><li> Experience with Agile Scrum development methodologies and common workflow tools: GIT, Jira, etc</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Understanding of REST APIs</li><li> Experience designing software for a distributed network for CAN or Ethernet communication</li><li> Experience designing software for display systems and closed loop control systems</li><li> Experience with common debugging tools such as oscilloscopes, network analyzer, emulators</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>Expert Level<p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.<p><br></p>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: FE International | Frontend Developer (w/ DevOps experience) [Remote]
description: Job Title: DevOps Engineer<p><br></p>Client Location: Chicago IL<p><br></p>Work Mode: Hybrid (once a week)<p><br></p>Manager Comments in Spotlight Call:<p><br></p>Help the team in CI/CD deployment in Harness<p><br></p>The contractor needs to Communicate with Architects across the Team<p><br></p>Understand CI/CD pipelines in Team-City (which they are currently using) and Re-write in Harness<p><br></p>Description:<p><br></p>Required:<p><br></p><ul><li> DevOps position with extensive Harness experience </li><li> Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Management Information Systems, and/or equivalent work experience </li><li> 6+ years of experience in design, development, documenting, testing, and debugging of new and existing software systems and/or applications for market sale or large-scale proprietary software for internal use </li><li> 3+ years of development experience in AWS cloud platform with good experience in CI/CD platform using Harness </li><li> 2-3 years of experience in using the following technologies: Python, Redshift, Git, Glue, CloudFormation, DynamoDB, Spark, and various CI/CD tools, particularly Harness </li><li> Proficiency in Software Development best practices such as – Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery, Unit/Integration testing, Code reviews </li><li> Worked closely with the architect for the development of applications </li><li> Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification </li><li> Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position </li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred:<p><br></p><ul><li> Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems </li><li> AWS – Solutions architect associate certification</li></ul>

title: Data Scientist II
description: In this position, you will be required to have extensive Javascript/ Typescript knowledge as well as experience building high performant user interface in order to visualise critical portfolio management tasks as well as to optimise and increase efficiency and accuracy of risks taken by traders and quants.<p><br></p>You will also be given the opportunity to work on backend code as well as instant feedback from users and opportunities to contribute to the design and architecture of systems that are built company wide.<p><br></p>Requirements.<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work closely with end users in order to design and deliver requirements in the form of well- built products.</li><li>Extensive software engineering experience.</li><li>Strong knowledge in Javascript/ Typescript as well as modern versions of react.</li><li>Understanding of Node.js performance optimisation.</li><li>Strong experience with API design and data modelling.</li><li>Strong knowledge of User- Interface design.</li></ul><p><br></p>If you are interested in knowing more, please reach out to me on mclement@fourier.london

title: Data Scientist II
description: Are you a skilled Java Engineer looking to work with a technologically advanced company and work with AI technology in your day to day? This is a division of a product based company that is a recognized leader in AI-powered pricing and promotions. Global brands and retailers like Coca Cola, Target, and CVS rely on the platform to optimize pricing in response to market conditions and to deliver higher ROI on promotional spend. Additionally, this is fully remote role, and this company really foster a collaborative environment where you can learn new skills!<p><br></p><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>At least 2-6 years of Java experience </li><li>Experience working with Scalable software and distributed systems </li><li>Experience working with relational databases such as MySQL </li><li>Knowledge of computer science concepts </li></ul> Desired Skills &amp; Experience<p><br></p><ul><li>Cloud experience with AWS, Google Cloud Platform, or Azure </li><li>Experience working with streaming technologies such as Kafka </li><li>Experience with Kubernetes or Google Kubernetes </li><li>B.S. in Computer Science or a related field </li><li>Strong desire to work in a team and strong communication skills </li></ul> What You Will Be Doing<p><br></p>Daily Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>70% Hands On </li><li>30% Team Collaboration </li></ul> Java Engineer/AI/Fully Remote<p><br></p>

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: Job Title: .NET Developer<p><br></p>Client Location: Chicago IL<p><br></p>Work Mode: Hybrid<p><br></p>Duration: Long-Term Contract<p><br></p>Description:<p><br></p>Job Summary: Program and build software using languages and technologies of the .NET framework. You will create applications from scratch, configure existing systems and provide user support.<p><br></p>Primary Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Participate in requirements analysis. </li><li> Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture. </li><li> Write clean, scalable code using .NET programming languages. </li><li> Test and deploy applications and systems. </li><li> Revise, update, refactor, and debug code. </li><li> Improve existing software. </li><li> Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC). Serve as an expert on applications and provide technical support. </li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li> A minimum of 5 years of experience as a Sr .NET Developer with a strong ability to resolve .NET security vulnerabilities (XSS, CORS, XSRF/CSRF, Authorization/Authentication/SQL Injection). </li><li> Strong ability to debug/troubleshoot .NET code modules and proficiency in writing TSQL queries.</li></ul>

title: Senior Associate Software Developer (Full Stack)
description: It is an exciting time to be part of the PatientPoint team! As the clear leader in the point-of-care industry, we offer an ideal, people-focused place to <strong>innovate</strong>, positively <strong>impact</strong> patient education and doctor-patient connections, and <strong>be</strong> <strong>inspired</strong> to build a great career.<br><br><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago<br><br><strong>Schedule </strong>1 Day in Office Per Week<br><br><strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>PatientPoint is looking for an experienced Principal QA Engineer / Software Test Automation Architect who will be responsible for the overall test automation strategy, tools, technology and process for the company’s software solutions. This role is instrumental in defining the approach to Software Test Automation at PatientPoint.<br><br>The ideal candidate will have deep experience in both Mobile, Web and Services automation testing, including an appreciation of the different technological solutions that are applicable, both through open source and Enterprise solutions. This role will establish metrics, mentor Software Engineers in Test, provide technical leadership and act as the most senior QA individual contributor leading the development of PatientPoint’s test automation strategy. This is not a managerial role and responsibilities do not include staff line management.<br><br><strong>What You’ll Do<br></strong><ul><li>Recommend, lead and continuously improve the architecture and technical direction of functional and performance tests. Advance product quality via testing innovations and process improvement.</li><li>Define core tools, frameworks and testing technologies to be used for testing Android client and Java Microservices projects.</li><li>Develop strategy and lead the integration of automation with the company’s CI/CD/build pipelines.</li><li>Lead QA automation efforts in developing robust and replicable test coverage for all PatientPoint products.</li><li>Create, document, and implement requirements for the automation of manual test plans, scripts, and test harnesses.</li><li>Lead technology evaluations and RFPs for automation solutions</li><li>Where appropriate integrate automation reporting with defect management systems</li><li>Coordination of the overall testing infrastructure including test data and test environments.</li><li>Architect, design and maintain the testing framework, testing tools, testing environment and testing standard across enterprise applications.</li><li>Collaborate with Product Managers, Architects &amp; Developers in designing testable applications.</li><li>Resolve technical issues, anticipate risks and ensure timely management escalation.</li><li>Ensure compliance to automation framework, standards &amp; best practices.</li><li>Facilitate automated, on-demand test automation metrics. Prepare quality documentation and reporting</li><li>Partner with Software Engineers and Software Engineers in Test to devise automation and test strategies including test cases development to drive the software development process towards quality-centric methodologies. Conduct test design reviews with Software Engineers in Test.</li><li>Mentor and guide Software Engineers in Test of all levels<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Need<br></strong><ul><li>12+ years overall experience in software engineering and QA roles</li><li>8+ years of experience in Java Software and development.</li><li>8+ years of working with AWS cloud hosted applications and services</li><li>8+ years of software engineering experience, demonstrating experience in scalable software design and development with a proven track record of technical achievements</li><li>4+ years of experience working with CI/CD tools (e.g. Jenkins, CircleCI, related technologies) and processes (g. GitFlow).</li><li>4+ years of experience developing, testing and/or integrating applications in a DevOps/Continuous Integration/Deployment environment using Jenkins, including Cloud deployments</li><li>2+ years of experience setting up the automation model at an enterprise level for web based applications and web services.</li><li>Significant experience in testing RESTful APIs and applicable tooling (e.g. Postman, JMeter)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Desired Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>MSc in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering</li><li>Experience in Android device testing and test framework e.g. Selenium, Appium</li><li>Expertise in performance testing / load testing.</li><li>Experience in multi-tiered, complex system design &amp; architecture.</li><li>Proficiency in test data and environment management including on-demand environment creation and configuration for test purposes.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You'll Need To Succeed<br></strong><ul><li>Deep experience in both Mobile, Web and Services automation testing</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences about goals, resource needs, timelines, and options.</li><li>Good knowledge of SDLC and Agile practice.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What We Offer<br><br></strong>We know you bring your whole self to work every day. That is why we are committed to providing modernized benefits and cultural perks to our teammates. We offer competitive compensation, comprehensive and affordable benefits, flex time off to rest and charge, where applicable, a hybrid work model, mental &amp; emotional wellness resources and coaching, 401K and more.<br><br><strong>About PatientPoint<br><br></strong>PatientPoint® is the patient engagement platform for every point of care. Our innovative, tech-enabled solutions create more effective doctor-patient interactions and deliver high value for patients, providers and healthcare sponsors. Through our nearly 140k unique healthcare provider relationships, PatientPoint’s solutions impact roughly 750 million patient visits each year, further advancing our mission of making every doctor-patient engagement better®. Learn more at patientpoint.com.<br><br><em>PatientPoint recognizes that privacy is important to you. Please read the PatientPoint privacy policy, we want you to be familiar with how we may collect, use, and disclose your information. Employer is EOE/M/F/D/V</em>

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>The Software Engineer - Test Level II (SET II) - is a unique opportunity within the Integration team for a software tester with development experience. The primary role will be to Develop Framework for end-to-end testing of applications. Develop customized Test Framework to support end to end testing applications on-prem and Google cloud. Secondarily, make applications more testable including testing using automation and manual. Individual must exhibit quick learning capabilities, be comfortable working with others as part of an Agile team and be able to interface effectively with support and development teams.<p><br></p>Principle Accountabilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop Automation Framework using Python and framework native language for Robot with Framework with given requirements.</li><li>Able to learn and use messaging protocols, DBs, APIs from end to end to develop framework.</li><li>Develops and implements designs for automated testing framework. Develops software for making applications on cloud more testable example messaging, APIs, DBs etc.</li><li>Ability to integrate current automation tools and new frameworks including Implementing new libraries to address automation challenges.</li><li>Work with Seniors in defining test requirements and methodologies for the automation framework.</li><li>Assist senior team members in identifying test scope, risks, and methodology approaches.</li><li>Execute test responsibilities with minimal supervision.</li><li>Create and maintain test documentation. Manually test as needed for projects and identify ways to automate.</li><li>Work with team members implementing automation opportunities and overcoming testability challenges.</li><li>Interface and communicate with internal teams and external support groups. This includes reports status, risks to senior team members.<br><br></li></ul>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Hands on Python or Java is a must. Understanding shell scripting a plus.</li><li>Software Requirements: Technical proficiency with Unix/Linux and SQL, Object Oriented principles preferably in Python, Oracle, Scripting.</li><li>Experience with Test Automation as well as manual testing.</li><li>Experience in Test Automation as well Manual testing. Ability to multi-task and handle more than one project</li><li>Good problem determination skills that help lead to problem resolution.</li><li>Education: Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related discipline is required; or equivalent combination of education and relevant proven work experience that is required for the specific job level.</li><li>Experience: 2-5 years prior development experience. Candidate must have demonstrated a successful Software Engineer in Test career progression.</li></ul><p><br></p>#Dice<p><br></p>CME Group: Where Futures Are Made<p><br></p>CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. description_json: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>The Software Engineer - Test Level II (SET II) - is a unique opportunity within the Integration team for a software tester with development experience. The primary role will be to Develop Framework for end-to-end testing of applications. Develop customized Test Framework to support end to end testing applications on-prem and Google cloud. Secondarily, make applications more testable including testing using automation and manual. Individual must exhibit quick learning capabilities, be comfortable working with others as part of an Agile team and be able to interface effectively with support and development teams.<p><br></p>Principle Accountabilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop Automation Framework using Python and framework native language for Robot with Framework with given requirements.</li><li>Able to learn and use messaging protocols, DBs, APIs from end to end to develop framework.</li><li>Develops and implements designs for automated testing framework. Develops software for making applications on cloud more testable example messaging, APIs, DBs etc.</li><li>Ability to integrate current automation tools and new frameworks including Implementing new libraries to address automation challenges.</li><li>Work with Seniors in defining test requirements and methodologies for the automation framework.</li><li>Assist senior team members in identifying test scope, risks, and methodology approaches.</li><li>Execute test responsibilities with minimal supervision.</li><li>Create and maintain test documentation. Manually test as needed for projects and identify ways to automate.</li><li>Work with team members implementing automation opportunities and overcoming testability challenges.</li><li>Interface and communicate with internal teams and external support groups. This includes reports status, risks to senior team members.<br><br></li></ul>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Hands on Python or Java is a must. Understanding shell scripting a plus.</li><li>Software Requirements: Technical proficiency with Unix/Linux and SQL, Object Oriented principles preferably in Python, Oracle, Scripting.</li><li>Experience with Test Automation as well as manual testing.</li><li>Experience in Test Automation as well Manual testing. Ability to multi-task and handle more than one project</li><li>Good problem determination skills that help lead to problem resolution.</li><li>Education: Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or other related discipline is required; or equivalent combination of education and relevant proven work experience that is required for the specific job level.</li><li>Experience: 2-5 years prior development experience. Candidate must have demonstrated a successful Software Engineer in Test career progression.</li></ul><p><br></p>#Dice<p><br></p>CME Group: Where Futures Are Made<p><br></p>CME Group (www.cmegroup.com) is the world's leading derivatives marketplace.
